messages: [{'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2018-12-30 20:01:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2019-01-03 14:00:26.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from federation-docs to bug/1793374'}, {'account_id': 21420, 'date': '2019-01-03 15:02:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2019-01-03 20:40:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-30 20:01:06.000000000', 'message': 'Restructure federation guide

Having everything on a single page is nice for ctrl-F-ability but it
makes the flow very confusing. This change breaks the guide into three
logical parts: the introduction, the configuration steps, and the
advanced mapping rules guide. Keeping all the configuration steps within
one page means it can still be searched easily, but removing the prose
of the introduction and breaking out the deep-dive mapping rules guide
reduces clutter and enhances readability.

Partial-bug: #1793374

Change-Id: Id2fd59d62a2675691d545e4cd0404558f00cf481
'}]
commit_message:
Restructure federation guide

Having everything on a single page is nice for ctrl-F-ability but it
makes the flow very confusing. This change breaks the guide into three
logical parts: the introduction, the configuration steps, and the
advanced mapping rules guide. Keeping all the configuration steps within
one page means it can still be searched easily, but removing the prose
of the introduction and breaking out the deep-dive mapping rules guide
reduces clutter and enhances readability.

Partial-bug: #1793374

Change-Id: Id2fd59d62a2675691d545e4cd0404558f00cf481

commit_message:
Add service provider tests for system member role

From keystone's perspective, the ``member`` and ``reader`` roles are
effectively the same, isolating writable service provider operations
to the ``admin`` role.

This commit adds explicit testing to make sure the ``member`` role is
allowed to perform readable and not writable service provider
operations. Subsequent patches will incorporate.

 - system admin functionality
 - domain users test coverage
 - project users test coverage

 Related-Bug: 1804520
 Related-Bug: 1804522

Change-Id: Iecc39d5e4f1a4dc9293e67ee86f23f9a119793a8

commit_message:
Update service provider policies for system reader

The service provider policies were not taking the default roles work
we did last release into account. This commit changes the default
policies to rely on the ``reader`` role for get and list service
providers. Subsequent patches will incorporate:

 - system member test coverage
 - system admin functionality
 - domain users test coverage
 - project users test coverage

 Related-Bug: 1804520
 Related-Bug: 1804522

Change-Id: I54fde6f6395b55a0798157346af3188bc756ba50

commit_message:
Prevent kmip_protocol logger from logging at DEBUG

At DEBUG, it will write out all wire data, which may expose key material.

Change-Id: Ic561f9eceb29eb783af368e27a341b9420b2783b
(cherry picked from commit 12b6d460f7c0b08eee330403fd7329fb4ad4e3cb)

subject: Print traceback for unexpected exception in keystone-manage
messages:
[{'account_id': 26970, 'date': '2018-12-26 08:29:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2018-12-27 21:57:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

Since this can impact operators, we need a release note. Documentation on how to add one can be found here [0].

[0] https://docs.openstack.org/keystone/latest/contributor/release-notes.html'}, {'account_id': 26970, 'date': '2019-01-02 01:32:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 26970, 'date': '2019-01-02 01:36:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 26970, 'date': '2019-01-02 05:03:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2019-01-02 10:09:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

I am not convinced this does what is intended. At the very least it should have a test in keystone/tests/unit/test_cli.py to show it works, but I would prefer a more fine-grained approach as Lance mentioned. commit_message:
Print traceback for unexpected exception in keystone-manage

Currently 'keystone-manage db_sync' (and also other commands) does not
catch any exception and it makes operator to be confused when db_sync
is failed since it does not emit any message at all.

Print exception at the end of the any keystone-manage command when
exception occurs.

Change-Id: I3e52e0ca012f3cca38e49849a2dd412111cdfa07
Closes-Bug: #1809779

hardcoded tags for prometheus-config-reloader and prometheus-operator
images [1] that doesn't match the ones we set in tripleo.

In turn, prometheus-operator v0.23.2 requires specific version of
different images. This commit updates all image tags to a combination

Change-Id: Ieea6d328d985199605f7d8b5cc654c011110621c

commit_message:
Fix tags for openshift images

The latest published image for cluster-monitoring-operator (v0.1.1) has
hardcoded tags for prometheus-config-reloader and prometheus-operator
images [1] that doesn't match the ones we set in tripleo.

In turn, prometheus-operator v0.23.2 requires specific version of
different images. This commit updates all image tags to a combination
that works out of the box.

[1] https://github.com/openshift/cluster-monitoring-operator/blob/v0.1.1/assets/prometheus-operator/deployment.yaml

Closes-Bug: #1809895
Change-Id: Ieea6d328d985199605f7d8b5cc654c011110621c

The commands used by constraints need at least tox 2.0.  Update to

commit_message:
Use oslo_log instead of alembic.util in functional tests

Instead of using alembic.utils logging functions which
prints output to stdout, lets use in functional tests
oslo_log logger to log all such commands.

This is needed to limit amount of output on stdout during
functional tests running on python3.5.

It was previously switched to use oslo_log in this migration
scripts always by [1] but because of issue in OSA we had to
revert this patch in [2].
So now let's try to change it only in functional tests.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/625555/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/626565/

Change-Id: I88fde6d107a1f1b5c48c5c89cd2e1c07fd12c755

commit_message:
fullstack: retry on updating port's IP address

If the update_port call failed with error IpAddressAlreadyAllocatedClient,
retry a few more times in order to find IP addresses that are available.

Change-Id: I7c5d51b01fa56083b1a689fa629a9a34c8b77012
Closes-Bug: #1808595

commit_message:
Fluent-logging: Add input and output for qemu logs

This adds an input to Fluentbit for capturing all qemu instance
logs in /var/log/libvirt/qemu/, and adds an Elasticsearch output
for those entries

Change-Id: I0802023f9861a5944e7989fd5469133c325349e7

commit_message:
Create Kibana Index Patterns

Use Kibana REST API to create Kibana index patterns and set a default
index pattern.
Script calling Kibana REST API is executed using a Job, and the specific
index patterns are configurable in values.yaml.

Change-Id: I1ca6dd9609e6d62d1ce749ee09e1490d51659709

commit_message:
Secret payload should also be fetched by UUID

We changed the client to fetch containers and secrets via their UUID
from the API, rather than by HREF, so that the endpoint URLs set in the
keystone client would be respected. Unfortunately, we (I) missed
updating the payload fetch function to do the same. This brings it into
line with the other fetches.

Change-Id: Ic71cf6771563d669a2fa37a56d4b40c637db1511
Story: 2004653
Task: 28608
(cherry picked from commit 4eec7121b39de3849b469c56d85b95520aab7bad)

commit_message:
Secret payload should also be fetched by UUID

We changed the client to fetch containers and secrets via their UUID
from the API, rather than by HREF, so that the endpoint URLs set in the
keystone client would be respected. Unfortunately, we (I) missed
updating the payload fetch function to do the same. This brings it into
line with the other fetches.

Change-Id: Ic71cf6771563d669a2fa37a56d4b40c637db1511
Story: 2004653
Task: 28608
(cherry picked from commit 4eec7121b39de3849b469c56d85b95520aab7bad)

commit_message:
Fix and consolidate cinder-backup host prep tasks

This patch consolidates the host prep tasks for the HA and non-HA
versions of the cinder-backup service. In addition to not maintaining
two separate lists, it fixes an error in the non-HA service.

Change-Id: I79709b64dc7f6cadc7dec9f80f64ca962d2f4130

commit_message:
Flatten Zaqar service configuration

This change combines the previous puppet and docker files into a single
file that performs the docker service installation and configuration.

With this patch the baremetal version of zaqar service has been removed.

Change-Id: I8947d2fc5e5672e701d2802cd14a3fa176877a7d
Related-Blueprint: services-yaml-flattening

commit_message:
Introduce container_cli hiera key

This hiera key is useful for when scripts want to figure out what tool
to call. This way they only need to call hiera in order to figure that
out.

Change-Id: I63dfd339a68ee1730e84cdcc32856f2fb4590cf4

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-04 17:40:22.000000000', 'message': 'Use InternalApi network for openshift_master_cluster_hostname

According to the inventory examples[1] openshift_master_cluster_hostname
points to an internal hostname/address set on the loadbalancer while
openshift_master_cluster_public_hostname points to the external.
This change sets openshift_master_cluster_hostname to use the InternalApi
network instead of the External network as it is at this moment.

Change-Id: I9efab5b07682efd6b03da433801d636e7d324619
(cherry picked from commit bd51cf5f4400524edb2ce0949972f0596480ca04)
'}]
commit_message:
Use InternalApi network for openshift_master_cluster_hostname

According to the inventory examples[1] openshift_master_cluster_hostname
points to an internal hostname/address set on the loadbalancer while
openshift_master_cluster_public_hostname points to the external.
This change sets openshift_master_cluster_hostname to use the InternalApi
network instead of the External network as it is at this moment.

[1] https://docs.openshift.com/container-platform/3.11/install/example_inventories.html

Change-Id: I9efab5b07682efd6b03da433801d636e7d324619
(cherry picked from commit bd51cf5f4400524edb2ce0949972f0596480ca04)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-04 17:42:07.000000000', 'message': 'Set balance to source for openshift_router endpoints

Currently the haproxy loadbalancer set by TripleO uses balance
roundrobin. According to this Openshift HA configuration example[1]
it uses balance source for both the API and the router backends.
This way we ensure that all traffic from a users session goes to
the same node(sticky sessions).

[1] https://blog.openshift.com/keeping-both-of-your-openshift-container-platforms-highly-available-with-keepalived-and-haproxy/

Change-Id: I0be466f7d30748fc46fc69f098bf5aa7eb980aa2
(cherry picked from commit 50de0269d0b63e4c5b07f4b5e0b355e7a29ddf97)
'}]
commit_message:
Set balance to source for openshift_router endpoints

Currently the haproxy loadbalancer set by TripleO uses balance
roundrobin. According to this Openshift HA configuration example[1]
it uses balance source for both the API and the router backends.
This way we ensure that all traffic from a users session goes to
the same node(sticky sessions).

[1] https://blog.openshift.com/keeping-both-of-your-openshift-container-platforms-highly-available-with-keepalived-and-haproxy/

Change-Id: I0be466f7d30748fc46fc69f098bf5aa7eb980aa2
(cherry picked from commit 50de0269d0b63e4c5b07f4b5e0b355e7a29ddf97)

We're deploying an additional glusterfs cluster on infra nodes with
Ife73d7c50c304cff7cd05e08f74855cb107f3c46 but never actually enabled
the registry to make use of it. This is controlled by the
openshift_hosted_registry_storage_kind variable which needs to be set
to 'glusterfs'.

Closes-Bug: #1804154
(cherry picked from commit b3eca20d2e99d08a7510eb4fe21b68e321e7f5d9)
"}]
commit_message:
Configure registry to use gluster

We're deploying an additional glusterfs cluster on infra nodes with
Ife73d7c50c304cff7cd05e08f74855cb107f3c46 but never actually enabled
the registry to make use of it. This is controlled by the
openshift_hosted_registry_storage_kind variable which needs to be set
to 'glusterfs'.

Change-Id: I67ae122447fdf0ae32f576b849dfa65cce4f30a3
Closes-Bug: #1804154
(cherry picked from commit b3eca20d2e99d08a7510eb4fe21b68e321e7f5d9)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-03 06:00:29.000000000', 'message': 'Remove unused nova packages from host during upgrade and update

As of now, during to upgrade from pike -> queens or doing
minor update on pike/queens deployment, the nova packages upgrade
on compute node changes the permissions on /var/lib/nova tree from
42436 (container nova uid) to 162 (host nova uid) which
prevents user from creating instances with permission Error.

This change handles removing unused nova packages from compute
host during major upgrade as well as minor update on explicitly.

Change-Id: I7e7167252f08f5df555912e0692f33649228fc83
(cherry picked from commit 669a7b8aeb71a3b394c784fa15e137a8edb7b08b)
'}]
commit_message:
Remove unused nova packages from host during upgrade and update

As of now, during to upgrade from pike -> queens or doing
minor update on pike/queens deployment, the nova packages upgrade
on compute node changes the permissions on /var/lib/nova tree from
42436 (container nova uid) to 162 (host nova uid) which
prevents user from creating instances with permission Error.

This change handles removing unused nova packages from compute
host during major upgrade as well as minor update on explicitly.

Change-Id: I7e7167252f08f5df555912e0692f33649228fc83
(cherry picked from commit 669a7b8aeb71a3b394c784fa15e137a8edb7b08b)

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-25 14:32:27.000000000', 'message': "Fixed concurrent access to direct io test file

When instances are deployed concurrently on multiple
compute nodes, nova-compute may fail on checking
direct io capabilities when instance_path is shared
across nodes. This fails on shared storage, that
doesn't support concurrent write access to the
same file, i.e. Virtuozzo Storage. To fix that we add
random string at the end of test file name.

commit_message:
Fixed concurrent access to direct io test file

When instances are deployed concurrently on multiple
compute nodes, nova-compute may fail on checking
direct io capabilities when instance_path is shared
across nodes. This fails on shared storage, that
doesn't support concurrent write access to the
same file, i.e. Virtuozzo Storage. To fix that we add
random string at the end of test file name.

Closes-Bug: #1727369
Change-Id: I085ade355fba0e9727a38d2dcbc9cffa735a62d1
Signed-off-by: Pavel Glushchak <pglushchak@virtuozzo.com>

(5 comments)'}, {'account_id': 2394, 'date': '2018-10-11 23:43:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Workflow-1

Based on Artom's comments, it occurred to me that the first chunk of work could be for implementing a HW_CPU_x86_AMD_SEV trait, and the second chunk of work would build on top of that and allow booting of SEV-encrypted instances.  This would eliminate the need for a temporary custom trait, which TBH felt like an ugly design hack in this spec which I'd be glad to get rid of.

This would also provide clear work items so that I can eliminate the final TODO.  Grateful for any other opinions on whether this is the best approach.

Will try to upload PS5 soonish taking this idea into account."}, {'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2018-10-12 00:16:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

You can draw inspiration from the way other specs were implemented, for example the native LUKS series [1] or the trusted VFs series [2]. I've linked to the bottom patches in both, to show the idea of implementing a spec in a "stack" of patches, with the more user-facing ones on top.

So for SEV for example, you could have a first patch in which the libvirt driver detects host SEV capabilities, on top of that a patch that uses that detection code to add the trait, on top of that the bit of code that generates the correct instance XML if there's the trait in the flavor (this could even be split in 2 - the new LibvirtConfig objects, and their use), on top of that the glue that passes that bit of into from the API down to the virt driver, etc. This is by no means an authoritative list, just using somewhat realistic guesses to make a point :)

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/460243/16
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/565808/6'}, {'account_id': 2394, 'date': '2018-10-12 09:25:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

@Artom That sounds like perfect advice - extremely helpful, thanks a lot! I'll update the spec ASAP (although today is pretty rammed so please bear with me...)"}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2018-10-12 16:50:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

@all I believe this is ready for full review now.

Thanks to Artom's advice, I think PS5 is a significantly nicer proposal than PS4: I've swapped the proposal in PS4 (start with custom traits, which TBH felt like a slightly ugly hack to me) with what was listed as the first alternative (start with a built-in trait) - but the hardware detection and trait implementation comes before anything which consumes those.  This feels a lot more elegant to me.

@JP Sure - please add whomever you feel appropriate; I haven't worked with the nova team much, so I'll gladly defer to others regarding who's best placed to review.  Thanks!"}, {'account_id': 2394, 'date': '2018-10-15 15:22:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-10-16 12:53:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1

Great spec, Adam!

-1 is just for a request to add a note in here about how to "solve" the per-instance memory consumption overhead. See lengthy comment inline for details, but tl;dr is that I'd like to see you add a note that says something to the effect of:

"Per-instance memory overhead should be handled using a similar solution as is recommended for other per-instance resource overheads: suggest that deployers increase the reserved amount of MEMORY_MB inventory records by an amount equal to (512MB * $NUM_EXPECTED_GUESTS_ON_HOST + $SAFETY_AMOUNT)."

or something like that...

Best,

-jay'}, {'account_id': 2394, 'date': '2018-10-22 13:30:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 2394, 'date': '2018-10-22 13:31:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

I'm good with this. It kinda sounds like the memory resource accounting is just done in-band by QEMU and not something that needs to be accounted for in host reserved memory or anything.

Basically, guests that have AMD SEV will just have a fraction of the total available memory available to the guest. Some portion of that memory will be consumed by the memory encryption and translation area that SEV uses. This would be transparent-ish for the end user. They would see an increased memory footprint from within their VM compared to a non-SEV-enabled VM but that is to be expected."}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2018-10-23 19:04:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Code-Review+1

a few nits but this largely makes sense to me.'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-10-23 19:12:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

(4 comments)

> I'm good with this. It kinda sounds like the memory resource accounting is just done in-band by QEMU and not something that needs to be accounted for in host reserved memory or anything.

Yep, as mentioned in my previous comment https://review.openstack.org/#/c/609779/10/specs/stein/approved/amd-sev-libvirt-support.rst@107, I think that's right.

> Basically, guests that have AMD SEV will just have a fraction of the total available memory available to the guest. Some portion of that memory will be consumed by the memory encryption and translation area that SEV uses. This would be transparent-ish for the end user. They would see an increased memory footprint from within their VM compared to a non-SEV-enabled VM but that is to be expected.

Again, as explained since the new information came to light, there is no additional overhead of SEV, just an extra requirement to ensure that the appropriate amount of memory (which is greater than the amount specified in the flavor) is locked to prevent swapping."}, {'account_id': 24938, 'date': '2018-10-23 22:38:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

Thanks again both for your continued patience on this :-)  I'm getting answers to your questions from the QEMU experts.  Since you're essentially +1 at this point, regarding the smaller fixes such as adding the missing word "live", is it cool if I submit those in a follow-up review?  I'm painfully aware of the risk of exhausting people by asking them to +1 many patchsets of a large review over and over again ;-)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-12-07 15:50:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 15:

(2 comments)

I'm just waiting on the response about volume-backed servers and config drive. My other nits could be fixed in a follow up if it turns out volume-backed and config drive will be fine."}, {'account_id': 2394, 'date': '2018-12-12 15:44:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

(2 comments)

If I understand the code right, the config drive disk mapping is built alongside the other disk mappings prior to instance launch (even though the config drive itself seems to be built late via post_xml_callback, after domain definition but prior to launch). So it's not hot-plugged post-launch which otherwise might have caused problems depending on the bus type.  Also I think it will either use "ide" or "virtio" bus (depending on whether the configdrive is iso9660 or vfat). Therefore we don't anticipate any problems with SEV. Nevertheless we're testing to make sure!'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-12-12 23:18:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 15:

OK so we'll see about config drive (yes your understanding of how/when it's built is correct for the libvirt driver) but we think it will work. Just wondering about volume-backed servers then..."}, {'account_id': 2394, 'date': '2018-12-13 14:18:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

@Matt it turns out that the q35 machine type (which SEV requires for reasons already explained in the spec) doesn't support the ide bus.  So with the current code, configdrive would only work if CONF.config_drive_format is set to vfat, in which case the virtio bus is used.  But this is only because there is a special exception in the code to use "ide" bus for cdrom devices on x86_64.  Most (all?) the other architectures use scsi.  I looked at the commit history via git blame and couldn't see any obvious reason for this exception other than that originally the code only supported x86_64 and used "ide", and then the other architectures were added in later.  So I'm wondering if this is purely a legacy thing - maybe we could scrap the use of ide altogether?  (And in that case, wouldn't virtio be a better choice than scsi anyway.)

Of course I could add an exception just for the SEV case, but that seems like unnecessary ugliness.  Anyway we'll continue investigating.

P.S. haven't forgotten about your question re: volume-backed servers!'}, {'account_id': 2394, 'date': '2018-12-13 14:19:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

Sorry, forgot to link to the special exception for x86_64 which I was referring to - here it is:

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/396156eb13521a0e7af4488a8cd4693aa65a0da2/nova/virt/libvirt/blockinfo.py#L257'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2018-12-14 20:21:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 2394, 'date': '2018-12-15 01:09:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 16.'}, {'account_id': 2394, 'date': '2018-12-15 01:16:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16:

(10 comments)'}, {'account_id': 2394, 'date': '2018-12-15 01:20:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16:

@mikal @mdbooth Would be hugely grateful if you could do a quick sanity check on the config-drive bits since I gather you are the experts - in particular the idea about dropping IDE CD-ROMs altogether or at least changing away from that default to bring x86 in line with other architectures.  Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-12-17 21:31:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 16: Code-Review+2

(5 comments)

Nits inline but I don't need another revision on this."}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2019-01-03 15:56:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

(9 comments)'}, {'account_id': 24938, 'date': '2019-01-03 18:16:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16:

Replied to the migration question.'}, {'account_id': 2394, 'date': '2019-01-03 18:22:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 16:

Thanks very much for the final reviews and for the merge!  I've just submitted I93840aa852b837c03ede9e21e720c1e1c1c773f2 to address the nits."}]

commit_message:
Add spec for libvirt driver launching AMD SEV-encrypted instances

This spec proposes work required in order for nova's libvirt driver to
support launching of KVM instances which are encrypted using AMD's
SEV (Secure Encrypted Virtualization) technology:

    https://developer.amd.com/sev/

blueprint: amd-sev-libvirt-support
Change-Id: Id7581365941ad40762a4732c33d359cfa75089fa

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-25 12:14:06.000000000', 'message': "Don't modify global variables in unit tests

The unit test
test_enable_dhcp_helper_enable_metadata_nonisolated_dist_network
modifies the global variables fake_port1, fake_port2, creating flakiness
on unit tests that use those variables when execured in environments
with high concurrency.

Creating a deepcopy of the variable avoid that those changes can be
propagated to other unit tests.

Closes-Bug: #1809643

Change-Id: Idfd0e99739952baf4d7b545b406cd1b251deb5f8
Signed-off-by: aojeagarcia <aojeagarcia@suse.com>
(cherry picked from commit e83e5618b7ca71fb96bf460922480b9808b431b6)
"}]
commit_message:
Don't modify global variables in unit tests

The unit test
test_enable_dhcp_helper_enable_metadata_nonisolated_dist_network
modifies the global variables fake_port1, fake_port2, creating flakiness
on unit tests that use those variables when execured in environments
with high concurrency.

Creating a deepcopy of the variable avoid that those changes can be
propagated to other unit tests.

Closes-Bug: #1809643

Change-Id: Idfd0e99739952baf4d7b545b406cd1b251deb5f8
Signed-off-by: aojeagarcia <aojeagarcia@suse.com>
(cherry picked from commit e83e5618b7ca71fb96bf460922480b9808b431b6)

messages:
[{'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2018-12-22 12:32:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2018-12-22 14:47:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2018-12-22 14:54:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2018-12-22 18:53:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

with bionic installing from shaman we get:

ceph                                  12.2.10-133-g7f094a2-1bionic
ceph-base                             12.2.10-133-g7f094a2-1bionic
ceph-common                           12.2.10-133-g7f094a2-1bionic
ceph-mds                              12.2.10-133-g7f094a2-1bionic
ceph-mgr                              12.2.10-133-g7f094a2-1bionic

ceph-osd                              12.2.10-133-g7f094a2-1bionic

nfs-ganesha-ceph:amd64                2.8-dev.3-0-ga650c29-1bionic
python-cephfs                         12.2.10-133-g7f094a2-1bionic

devstack stacks successfully but when you do 'manila access-allow <share> ip 1.1.1.1' this happens in manila-share-log:

sudo manila-rootwrap /etc/manila/rootwrap.conf dbus-send --print-reply --system --dest=org.ganesha.nfsd /org/ganesha/nfsd/ExportMgr org.ganesha.nfsd.exportmgr.AddExport string:/etc/ganesha/export.d/share-71ad27c3-5b9a-49ac-93be-af2e1eaabfd1.conf.Z11eiC string:EXPORT(Export_Id=1001)

Dec 21 18:51:22.912592 ubuntu-bionic-rax-iad-0001368725 manila-share[60912]: Exit code: 1
Dec 21 18:51:22.912592 ubuntu-bionic-rax-iad-0001368725 manila-share[60912]: Stdout: u''
Dec 21 18:51:22.912592 ubuntu-bionic-rax-iad-0001368725 manila-share[60912]: Stderr: u'Error org.freedesktop.DBus.Error.ServiceUnknown: The name org.ganesha.nfsd was not provided by any .service files\n'

And in /var/log/ganesha/ganesha.log at the same timestamp we see:

21/12/2018 18:51:19 : epoch 5c1d3576 : ubuntu-bionic-rax-iad-0001368725 : ganesha.nfsd-55630[dbus_heartbeat] load_fsal :NFS STARTUP :FATAL :Could not dlopen module: /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/ganesha/libfsalceph.so Error: /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/ganesha/libfsalceph.so: undefined symbol: ceph_start_reclaim. You might want to install the nfs-ganesha-Ceph package

It works OK just using the bionic apt packages."}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2019-01-03 03:06:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2019-01-03 11:17:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2019-01-03 14:56:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2019-01-03 17:25:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

I think this change is safe and we need to move ahead in manila so I'm going to merge it.  Ramana, if we need to be able to test upstream shaman repo code as well we can add an experimental job to do that (right now it will fail)."}]

commit_message:
Use official bionic repos for manila

The shaman ceph and ganesha repos for ubuntu bionic are less
stable than those available with the bionic distro itself so
use the latter.

Also refactor the ceph/ganesha repo configuration so that it
is easier to read and maintain, and since bionic does not ship
with knfs installed make the service stop/disable for these
services robust in that case.

Change-Id: If00cc82cfb076c75a11738dcaca372b0cc7a1848

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-01 15:55:20.000000000', 'message': "Move role_create_update_show_list to static

only cls.role is needed to execute:
test_role_create_update_show_list()

so I moved the resource_setup for that into its own
class and reused it in both test classes.

I don't see any limitations by using pre-provisioned
credentials on this test.

By setting force_tenant_isolation=False this test can now be
executed with backends that enforce immutable user sources.

NOTE this patch is based on:
I5930c5f9d68b0258620e6de90398b34f84e06d9f
as they both modify the resource_cleanup method

Change-Id: I5c97bef8c9dbfab450830ab6a304ee024b467e0e

A number of tests should be executed with backends that enforce or
use immutable user sources. This patchset moves those tests into a
separate class with ``force_tenant_isolation=False`` set so they are
executed against such backend.

NOTE:
  * test_assignments_for_domain_roles is not interop but using the
    os_primary user and project returned many unexpected effective
    roles, so it was left in the original test class.
  * test_domain_roles_create_delete is moved to static but I had to
    delete the assertEqual(1, len(domain_roles)) check as there
    were more than 1 domain role associated with the default domain
    and edit the last check from assertEmpty to assertNotIn for the
    same reason.

Co-Authored-By: Tin Lam <tin@irrational.io>
Partial-Bug: #1714277
Change-Id: I5c97bef8c9dbfab450830ab6a304ee024b467e0e
'}, {'created': '2018-07-12 20:57:02.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Refactor tests to static

A number of tests should be executed with backends that enforce or
use immutable user sources. This patchset moves those tests into a
separate class with ``force_tenant_isolation=False`` set so they are
executed against such backend.

NOTE:
  * test_assignments_for_domain_roles is not interop but using the
    os_primary user and project returned many unexpected effective
    roles, so it was left in the original test class.
  * test_domain_roles_create_delete is moved to static but I had to
    delete the assertEqual(1, len(domain_roles)) check as there
    were more than 1 domain role associated with the default domain
    and edit the last check from assertEmpty to assertNotIn for the
    same reason.
    - alternatively, I could use the same pattern used in
      test_assignments_for_implied_roles_create_delete
  * test_assignments_for_implied_roles_create_delete is moved to static
    but I had to modify it for the assertEqual call. Instead of assuming

commit_message:
WIP: Refactor tests to static

A number of tests should be executed with backends that enforce or
use immutable user sources. This patchset moves those tests into a
separate class with ``force_tenant_isolation=False`` set so they are
executed against such backend.

NOTE:
  * test_assignments_for_domain_roles is not interop but using the
    os_primary user and project returned many unexpected effective
    roles, so it was left in the original test class.
  * test_domain_roles_create_delete is moved to static but I had to
    delete the assertEqual(1, len(domain_roles)) check as there
    were more than 1 domain role associated with the default domain
    and edit the last check from assertEmpty to assertNotIn for the
    same reason.
    - alternatively, I could use the same pattern used in
      test_assignments_for_implied_roles_create_delete
  * test_assignments_for_implied_roles_create_delete is moved to static
    but I had to modify it for the assertEqual call. Instead of assuming
    there are no roles already assigned to the user, the test now accounts
    for the number of existing roles before in the length check of the two
    lists
    - alternatively, I think I can just remove the assertEqual call on the
      list lengths like how I did in test_domain_roles_create_delete

Co-Authored-By: Tin Lam <tin@irrational.io>
Partial-Bug: #1714277
Change-Id: I5c97bef8c9dbfab450830ab6a304ee024b467e0e

Update logged text to indicate our intentions with respect
to the show_multiple_locations configuration option, which
has been deprecated since Newton and advertised as subject
to removal in Pike.  Also correct the misleading impression
in the deprecation notice and earlier release notes that
functionality that requires show_multiple_locations = True
can be configured via policies at the current time.  Also

commit_message:
Update show_multiple_locations deprecation note

Update logged text to indicate our intentions with respect
to the show_multiple_locations configuration option, which
has been deprecated since Newton and advertised as subject
to removal in Pike.  Also correct the misleading impression
in the deprecation notice and earlier release notes that
functionality that requires show_multiple_locations = True
can be configured via policies at the current time.  Also
adds a release note to this effect.

Not a straight cherry-pick.  Changed the section of the
relase note from 'upgrade' to 'issues' because this is more
of a "known issue" in the stable branches.

Change-Id: I5bf0c8af9dfe87e0d17f7a16d4676f387b4379f6
Closes-bug: #1808375
(cherry picked from commit de72ac4a01be1ccc75825eb941dad64c170d6bea)
(cherry picked from commit d2bb38d58bac9c22c2a8f27739720db43f3af290)

commit_message:
Add pretasks to exit quick when needed

The journalbeat playbook uses conditionals to know when to deploy the
journalbeat collector. This change makes it so the playbook simply exits
when the journal is not found or the environment being deployed is not
using systemd. This change will result in faster deployments in mixed
environments as the role will no longer need to iterate over its
conditional.

Change-Id: I581b61902723f54237623036566a83c9be79210e
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

[{'created': '2018-12-13 21:35:41.000000000', 'message': 'Allow disabling TFTP image cache

We document that this can be disabled by setting the
[pxe]tftp_master_path config  to "<None>", but don't
actually support it in code. oslo.config doesn't actually
translate that value to the Python None as we expect.

Allow disabling the cache by setting the config to the empty
string, as in "tftp_master_path=". This doesn't make sense as
a directory to use as a cache anyway, so it shouldn't break anyone.

Change-Id: Icc7d08ae47e0e450a612c922ae3d665c56880262
Story: 2004608
Task: 28506

commit_message:
Allow disabling TFTP image cache

We document that this can be disabled by setting the
[pxe]tftp_master_path config  to "<None>", but don't
actually support it in code. oslo.config doesn't actually
translate that value to the Python None as we expect.

Allow disabling the cache by setting the config to the empty
string, as in "tftp_master_path=". This doesn't make sense as
a directory to use as a cache anyway, so it shouldn't break anyone.

Change-Id: Icc7d08ae47e0e450a612c922ae3d665c56880262
Story: 2004608
Task: 28506

commit_message:
Remove useless test samples for v2.66

These samples were unused and incorrect. We don't actually need the
sample, since v2.66 is about listing servers and filtering with
'changes-before', so responses to show a server are unnecessary. Simply
remove the sample.

Closes-Bug: #1800936
Change-Id: I12cf3ffd75098677cf5de1a5f40d783bb661fd74

commit_message:
Add network-segment-range extension API definition

This patch adds the network-segment-range extension's API definition
into neutron-lib.

Co-authored-by: Allain Legacy <Allain.legacy@windriver.com>

Needed-by: https://review.openstack.org/624708

Partially-implements: blueprint network-segment-range-management
Change-Id: Ieb799c42e995f0612c3ba3eb8a7960be77178e07

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-21 00:06:52.000000000', 'message': 'Add functional regression recreate test for bug 1790204

Since Pike, the FilterScheduler "claims" resources in
placement via allocations based on the flavor during
scheduling. For a same-host resize, the old and new flavor
are summed to get the overall allocation against the single
compute node resource provider, which can cause NoValidHost
failures during scheduling because the sum is over capacity
for the resource provider even though the new flavor alone
may be OK.

This adds a functional regression test to recreate the bug.

Change-Id: I036a5ceabe88dcc1fd85c09472481de7d02edf5f
Related-Bug: #1790204

Since Pike, the FilterScheduler "claims" resources in

scheduling. For a same-host resize, the old and new flavor

commit_message:
Add functional regression recreate test for bug 1790204

Since Pike, the FilterScheduler "claims" resources in
placement via allocations based on the flavor during
scheduling. For a same-host resize, the old and new flavor
are summed to get the overall allocation against the single
compute node resource provider, which can cause NoValidHost
failures during scheduling because the sum is over capacity
for the resource provider even though the new flavor alone
may be OK.

This adds a functional regression test to recreate the bug.

Change-Id: I036a5ceabe88dcc1fd85c09472481de7d02edf5f
Related-Bug: #1790204

commit_message:
Allow custom LocalContainerRegistry tht value

Fix LocalContainerRegistry hardcode to local_ip / --local-ip port 8787
and allow overrides via heat params.

Define DockerInsecureRegistryAddress list via LocalContainerRegistry
instead of local_ip:8787 hardcode.

Make LocalContainerRegistry aligned with DockerInsecureRegistryAddress
allowing <IP:PORT> values for both.

Depends-On: I40ecf0284ed97ffd8a8baed9fdeeb7d19918dc17
Change-Id: Ifac95651fc459b9616e3c10d33a85b8eaf02c674
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Allow IP and port for LocalContainerRegistry

Align LocalContainerRegistry with DockerInsecureRegistryAddress,
allowing it to take IP or IP:Port. This also allows a custom port
for it instead of only 8787 allowed before.

Change-Id: I40ecf0284ed97ffd8a8baed9fdeeb7d19918dc17
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Remove deploy steps on empty roles

When a role count is 0, we can create the deployment resources
conditionally.

Closes-Bug: #1671859
Change-Id: I467b9ded1a1b33d520cb69aa86b253a0552643f7

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-10 16:57:24.000000000', 'message': "Calculate undercloud ctlplane DHCP allocation pools

* Make dhcp_start and dhcp_end optional for subnet definitions
  in undercloud.conf.
* Allow non-contiguous allocation pools for ctlplane subnets

Calcualte the allocation pools by removing the local_ip,
gateway, admin_host, public_host and ``inspection_iprange``,
from the subnets full ip range. Allocation_pools for all
remaining ranges will be configured.

If dhcp_start is defined and dhcp_end is not defined (or vice
versa) any addresses prior to (or after) this address is
removed from the allocation pools.

Make dhcp_start and dhcp_end options ListOpts to enable non-
contigous allocation pools. For example, to create allocation
pools: [{'start': '172.20.0.100', 'end': '172.20.0.150'},
        {'start': '172.20.0.200', 'end': '172.20.0.250'}]
the following configuration can be used in undercloud.conf:

  dhcp_start = 172.20.0.100,172.20.0.200
  dhcp_end = 172.20.0.150,172.20.0.250

The local_subnet still need default dhcp_start an dhcp_end
values defined for backward compatibility. A new method is
added for remote_subnet_opts, same options as for the
local_subnet_opts but without the defaults. This allow the
user not to specify dhcp_start and/or dhcp_end at all for
these subnets and have allocation pools automatically
created.

Note: Also renames some of the test files to avoid conflicts
when using oslo_fixture for config.

Related-Bug: #1806512
Related-Bug: #1807707
Change-Id: I4ba148f465b4c452bd5b2c31009ac8a2897bcd5f
"}, {'created': '2018-12-11 00:19:21.000000000', 'message': "Calculate undercloud ctlplane DHCP allocation pools

* Make dhcp_start and dhcp_end optional for subnet definitions
  in undercloud.conf.
* Allow non-contiguous allocation pools for ctlplane subnets

Calcualte the allocation pools by removing the local_ip,
gateway, admin_host, public_host and ``inspection_iprange``,
from the subnets full ip range. Allocation_pools for all
remaining ranges will be configured. A new per-subnet option
``dhcp_exclude`` is added, a list of IP addresses or IP
ranges that will be excluded from the allocation pool. For
example:

  dhcp_exclude = 172.20.0.101,172.20.0.210-172.20.0.219
                   ^ ip addr         ^ ip range

If dhcp_start is defined and dhcp_end is not defined (or vice
versa) any addresses prior to (or after) this address is
removed from the allocation pools.

Make dhcp_start and dhcp_end options ListOpts to enable non-
contigous allocation pools. For example, to create allocation
pools: [{'start': '172.20.0.100', 'end': '172.20.0.150'},
        {'start': '172.20.0.200', 'end': '172.20.0.250'}]
the following configuration can be used in undercloud.conf:

  dhcp_start = 172.20.0.100,172.20.0.200
  dhcp_end = 172.20.0.150,172.20.0.250

A new method is added for remote_subnet_opts, same options as
for the local_subnet_opts but without the defaults.

To allow optional dhcp_start and dhcp_end for the local_subnet
which have defaults defined, a condition is used to ignore
dhcp_start and dhcp_end in case they are the default values
and the cidr is NOT the default.

Note: Also renames some of the test files to avoid conflicts
when using oslo_fixture for config.

Related-Bug: #1806512
Related-Bug: #1807707
Change-Id: I4ba148f465b4c452bd5b2c31009ac8a2897bcd5f

commit_message:
Calculate undercloud ctlplane DHCP allocation pools

* Make dhcp_start and dhcp_end optional for subnet definitions
  in undercloud.conf.
* Allow non-contiguous allocation pools for ctlplane subnets

Calcualte the allocation pools by removing the local_ip,
gateway, admin_host, public_host and ``inspection_iprange``,
from the subnets full ip range. Allocation_pools for all
remaining ranges will be configured. A new per-subnet option
``dhcp_exclude`` is added, a list of IP addresses or IP
ranges that will be excluded from the allocation pool. For
example:

  dhcp_exclude = 172.20.0.101,172.20.0.210-172.20.0.219
                   ^ ip addr         ^ ip range

If dhcp_start is defined and dhcp_end is not defined (or vice
versa) any addresses prior to (or after) this address is
removed from the allocation pools.

Make dhcp_start and dhcp_end options ListOpts to enable non-
contigous allocation pools. For example, to create allocation
pools: [{'start': '172.20.0.100', 'end': '172.20.0.150'},
        {'start': '172.20.0.200', 'end': '172.20.0.250'}]
the following configuration can be used in undercloud.conf:

  dhcp_start = 172.20.0.100,172.20.0.200
  dhcp_end = 172.20.0.150,172.20.0.250

A new method is added for remote_subnet_opts, same options as
for the local_subnet_opts but without the defaults.

To allow optional dhcp_start and dhcp_end for the local_subnet
which have defaults defined, a condition is used to ignore
dhcp_start and dhcp_end in case they are the default values
and the cidr is NOT the default.

Related-Bug: #1806512
Related-Bug: #1807707
Change-Id: I4ba148f465b4c452bd5b2c31009ac8a2897bcd5f

commit_message:
Better support for community images

This commit updates several places where image information is processed
and extends support for the 'community' image visibility value.

Some support did exist already, which was mostly just the main Images
tab of the dashboard, but this commit also includes support for:
  - image name in the instances list/details
  - 'Community' visibility label in the Images tab
  - Listing of community images in launch instance wizard

Closes-Bug: #1779250

Change-Id: Iedea0b7d20313837a72a2759511251a7bb324869

commit_message:
Update CRD when NP has podSelectors

When a pod gets created, deleted or updated and its labels
matches the PodSelector of a NP, the sg must be updated.

Partially Implements: blueprint k8s-network-policies

Change-Id: Ic0dd3bc93e2453460c4d8dea360efd414b6ae42b

commit_message:
Query cluster's Heat stack ID in functional tests

In the functional tests, the cluster object returned by magnum cluster
create request is stored on the test case object and never updated. This
object may have a stack_id that is None, as the stack is created
asynchronously.

This change queries the cluster when the stack ID is required, to ensure
that it is up to date.

Change-Id: I004c11e23826bc0cf96bc24e786bca9c1ef61213

[{'created': '2019-01-03 11:26:29.000000000', 'message': 'Fix puppet beaker jobs for bundler 2.0

bundler 2.0 requires rubygems 3.0, so we need to update past what the
distro offers. rubygems 3.0 removed the --[no-]rdoc and --[no-]ri flags
from the gem command.

Change-Id: Id19edd37dcdbaea058dbec60cb25d2ca7560bb46
'}, {'created': '2019-01-03 12:01:13.000000000', 'message': 'Pin bundler for puppet rspec jobs

Ubuntu and not compatible with the ruby version on CentOS 7.

Change-Id: Id19edd37dcdbaea058dbec60cb25d2ca7560bb46

bundler 2.0 requires rubygems 3.0 which is not available by default on

commit_message:
Pin bundler for puppet rspec jobs

bundler 2.0 requires rubygems 3.0 which is not available by default on
Ubuntu and not compatible with the ruby version on CentOS 7.

Change-Id: Id19edd37dcdbaea058dbec60cb25d2ca7560bb46

subject: Add "prev" link to instance page list pagination

1) With this patch we still stay at the same page if there is no instance and 'items per page' == 1. I think we should follow to the next page if current page is empty. As an option we can get 'prev' or 'next' link somewhere in this function https://github.com/openstack/horizon/blob/03d671f4db79b9b619919099f48888deadff1212/horizon/static/horizon/js/horizon.tables.js#L46  and follow to this link. If you have a better solution you can propose something else.
2) If I set 'items per page' = 2 and create 5 instances, follow to the second page and delete 1 instance from the second page, then go to the third page and return back to the second page I have 2 instances on the second page, 1 instance on the third page and 1 instance on the first page. I think this is not expexted behavior."}, {'account_id': 8478, 'date': '2017-09-25 13:45:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

Looks like this patch fixes only some of the issues.  I tested it with following steps:

1) we've got N items per page
2) create N*3 instances
3) go to the instances page and press 'next' link
4) select all N instances on the page and delete them
5) repeat step #4 once more

Actual result: 'No items to display.' message is sown but we still have N instances
Expected result: we've got N instances shown or 'prev' button available


Unfortunately, we don't have a lot of notes from PTG except [1]. AFAIR, we've got an agreement to return a user to the first page if an item or all items from the page were deleted. It changes our current UX behavior but makes logic and code less buggy and complex. Also, such approach could be easily adapted for other pages in Horizon and user won't see 'No items to display.' if any items are in the DB.

Looks like the current patch is much better but it still has issues. I followed a simple scenario: go to the last page, check all instances, delete all instances, repeat these steps. During such testing I faced the following issues:
sometimes I see 1 instance per page instead of 2 (I still have even count of instances)
sometimes it redirects me to the first page, sometimes not

The second scenario:
I still have 2 items per page in settings:
create 2 instances using count=2 option via horizon
repeat previous step
As a result: I see only 2 instances and no prev/next buttons at all'}, {'account_id': 18889, 'date': '2017-11-24 19:39:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 23.'}, {'account_id': 18889, 'date': '2017-11-24 19:53:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 23:

Ivan,
I was tried improving the rendering. Problem: When a server is marked for deletion it takes time until it is removed from the output for servers.list(). I do the trick 'over-scan' I mean I'm trying to have the server off-screen while it has the transient state. It works well if You delete one server, but if you do multiple ones the trick may fail. The updated patch now follows nova's exact listing (key), hence 
 displays better. As You remember the existing code first colored the servers being deleted and later removed from the list displayed."}, {'account_id': 27386, 'date': '2017-12-04 08:08:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 23: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 18889, 'date': '2017-12-04 08:44:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 24.'}, {'account_id': 18889, 'date': '2017-12-09 15:41:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 24:

-1 from my testing result.

I created 9 servers. The page size is set to 5.
I opened the instance table, clicked "Next" link and then clicked "Prev" link.
When "Prev" link is clicked, I expected the first 5 servers (which were shown first are shown but no server is shown.

This is a bit confusing behavior from UX perspective.

Note that Nova API returns an empty list as a response of the third server listing request. I wonder the usage of Nova API is correct or not.

The detail log is here: http://paste.openstack.org/show/718768/'}, {'account_id': 18889, 'date': '2018-04-11 12:10:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 31:

Akihiro I can't reporoduce the situation You are experiencing:

9 instances is created, page size is set to 5.
o Instances listing default:  https://imagebin.ca/v/3y0mW2h6HnME
o Instances Listing when "next" link is pressed:
  https://imagebin.ca/v/3y0o2KfHYyop novaclient: DEBUG novaclient.v2.client REQ: curl -g -i -X GET http://192.168.122.42:8774/v2.1/servers/detail?limit=6&project_id=1eed9cd37b9c470294751fbe09eb6794&sort_dir=desc
0  Instances Listing when "prev" link is pressed:  https://imagebin.ca/v/3y0ofz4Nwmxs novaclent: DEBUG novaclient.v2.client REQ: curl -g -i -X GET http://192.168.122.42:8774/v2.1/servers/detail?limit=6&marker=2ee70e6b-8030-4bcb-903e-21c31612cc45&project_id=1eed9cd37b9c470294751fbe09eb6794&sort_dir=asc'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-04-11 15:59:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 31:

Frence, it looks like the order of servers in a response for sort_dir asc and desc are not symmetric. In my understanding, this implementation assume that the response for sort_dir=asc is the reverse order of the response for sort_dir=desc (default).

This is my testing result of Nova servers API. http://paste.openstack.org/show/718951/

Is it what you expect?'}, {'account_id': 18889, 'date': '2018-04-12 06:21:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 31:

Akihiro,
sorry i cannot translate the concept "simmetry" - the view rendering logic is a little bit mind blowing, when I was trying mentally absolve the dualism of ordering and list traversing took me one day, however if I depict here with a figure, it can be called straight forward.
 instamce/server list in nova/galera, key is uuid
 TAIL
 .
 :
 A 
 B <- "next" marker 
 C
 D
 E
 F <-marker
 G
 H
 I
 J
 :
 .
 O
 P
 Q
 R
 HEAD

Let assume "page size" is 4. Enter to "instances" collection, We are in HEAD position. Display shows R,Q,P,O (in that order). Somewhere "next" is pressed, display origin reach 'F'. The wiew shows E,D,C,B (in that order). "prev" is pressed, marker stays on 'F', display shows G,H,I,J. "next" is pressed, marker enhances to 'B', the wiew shows F,E,D,C (in that order)'}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2018-04-12 06:58:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 31: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 18889, 'date': '2018-04-24 09:57:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 32.'}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2018-09-06 07:46:06.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

the expected behavior is showing the next instance in the table after one is
deleted.

commit_message:
Add "prev" link to instance page list pagination

Currently there is no link to previous page at paginated instances
table. This patch resolves that issue by re-using the pagination
code for flavors.

It also supports Ying Zuo's scenario:
After I set only 1 item per page and deleted the instance on the first page,
the expected behavior is showing the next instance in the table after one is
deleted.

xxxIndexView uses PagedTableMixin's _get_marker() from now instead of GET()-
ing the markers

Closes-Bug: #1274427
Co-Authored-By: Dmitry Ratushnyy <dratushn@cisco.com>
Co-Authored-By: Akihiro Motoki <amotoki@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Id8eaae6bf1b5d6f42291291655e14b8715c08bc8
Signed-off-by: Ferenc Cserepkei <ferenc.cserepkei@ericsson.com>

subject: DNM: Test upgrading Docker to Community Edition
messages:
[{'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-11-21 19:21:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-11-22 09:09:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-11-22 09:12:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Published edit on patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-11-22 11:34:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Containers not being restarted after upgrade :('}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-11-22 11:47:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-11-22 14:14:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Published edit on patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-11-22 16:10:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Published edit on patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-11-22 17:57:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-11-23 09:45:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Published edit on patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-11-23 11:44:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Published edit on patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-11-23 13:29:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

Non-Ceph jobs looking good. In the Ceph jobs for some reason we get a gateway timeout when accessing keystone. Keystone fernet container is also restarting, cannot ssh/rsync.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-12-13 15:58:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Published edit on patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-12-13 16:08:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-12-13 18:02:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11:

> Non-Ceph jobs looking good. In the Ceph jobs for some reason we get
 > a gateway timeout when accessing keystone. Keystone fernet
 > container is also restarting, cannot ssh/rsync.

Looked again at this, it seems to be caused by the containers on the secondary nodes not running. This is because the container start command in run.yml is only executed on the primary.

I've proposed https://review.openstack.org/#/c/625076/1 to try starting containers automatically after a Docker upgrade."}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-12-14 12:46:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-01-03 12:40:10.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Only used for testing'}]

commit_message:
DNM: Test upgrading Docker to Community Edition

First installs Docker legacy package, then deploys OpenStack, then
upgrades Docker to Community edition.

Change-Id: I1bb911ee709ba54c9d36cdf674a3fc3f15fa2be2

commit_message:
Migrate horizon-dsvm-tempest-plugin job to python3

Python 3 and python 3.6 classifiers are added
so that DevStack recognizes horizon works with python3.

Change-Id: I2ab0a1a9df9292090f8f14b1591b98d691e16bc4

commit_message:
Integrate kuryr-kubernetes for container-based VNFs

This spec integrates kuryr-kubernetes for c-VNFs to enable
neutron-based networking for container-based VNFs.

We also provide means to support hybrid VNFs and SFC.

Change-Id: I17880e965a5baf4fafd69815646db2c04f358ae2

commit_message:
SHOW_KEYSTONE_V2_RC defaults to False

In favor of keystone v2 support, SHOW_KEYSTONE_V2_RC now defaults
to False. SHOW_KEYSTONE_V2_RC setting is also deprecated.

Along with this change, "v3" part of "OpenStack RC File (Identity API v3)"
is now unnecessary, so "v3" information is dropped.

Change-Id: If0359e2dc1f2c8fb5f3c87046fd23043f94abc21

subject: Ignore undefined values in customizable filter
messages: [{'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-12-27 09:12:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 23717, 'date': '2018-12-28 06:26:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 19316, 'date': '2019-01-02 09:45:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 19316, 'date': '2019-01-03 08:46:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nrecheck'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-27 09:12:01.000000000', 'message': 'Ignore undefined values in customizable filter

When using the customizable filter to modify variables, if a template
overrides file is shared between multiple sets of images, it is sometimes
possible that a customised variable does not exist for a set of images.
A specific example:

My template overrides file has this:

{% set ironic_inspector_packages_append = ["python-pip"] %}

Normally I build binary/centos images.

kolla-build -t binary

Sometimes however I build a bifrost centos/source image, because bifrost
does not support binary images.

kolla-build -t source bifrost

The ironic inspector image does not define ironic_inspector_packages for
the source build, since it does not need any.

{% elif install_type == 'source' %}
    {% if base_distro in ['debian', 'ubuntu'] %}
        {% set ironic_inspector_packages = ['iptables'] %}
    {% endif %}

{{ macros.install_packages(ironic_inspector_packages |
        customizable("packages")) }}

The install_packages macro copes with the undefined variable, however
the customizable filter does not handle the base variable being
undefined if a customised example exists.

This change allows the customizable filter to ignore undefined
variables, even if they have been customised.

Change-Id: Ibe2fc91f5b6ceee8f937dd73c235128b2db525b1
Closes-Bug: #1809491
(cherry picked from commit f8d86969d0c042fd29d29df41ddd4052f687af55)
'}]
commit_message:
Ignore undefined values in customizable filter

When using the customizable filter to modify variables, if a template
overrides file is shared between multiple sets of images, it is sometimes
possible that a customised variable does not exist for a set of images.
A specific example:

My template overrides file has this:

{% set ironic_inspector_packages_append = ["python-pip"] %}

Normally I build binary/centos images.

kolla-build -t binary

Sometimes however I build a bifrost centos/source image, because bifrost
does not support binary images.

kolla-build -t source bifrost

The ironic inspector image does not define ironic_inspector_packages for
the source build, since it does not need any.

{% elif install_type == 'source' %}
    {% if base_distro in ['debian', 'ubuntu'] %}
        {% set ironic_inspector_packages = ['iptables'] %}
    {% endif %}

{{ macros.install_packages(ironic_inspector_packages |
        customizable("packages")) }}

The install_packages macro copes with the undefined variable, however
the customizable filter does not handle the base variable being
undefined if a customised example exists.

This change allows the customizable filter to ignore undefined
variables, even if they have been customised.

Change-Id: Ibe2fc91f5b6ceee8f937dd73c235128b2db525b1
Closes-Bug: #1809491
(cherry picked from commit f8d86969d0c042fd29d29df41ddd4052f687af55)

messages: [{'account_id': 8674, 'date': '2018-12-21 15:09:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-12-22 13:52:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2019-01-03 10:41:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-21 15:09:29.000000000', 'message': 'Fix images minimum ram and disk default values

When uploading an image, if we do not set a minimum ram and disk size we
try to send "None" to glance.
We should instead send "0" and glance will calculate the size from the
provided image.

Change-Id: Ia1aeabcdcf021943ebb7a4e35939c383ac820b19
Closes-Bug: #1809121
(cherry picked from commit 65b21e7f9de7f5a465dd4c5d921ac476d8e1500a)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix images minimum ram and disk default values

When uploading an image, if we do not set a minimum ram and disk size we
try to send "None" to glance.
We should instead send "0" and glance will calculate the size from the
provided image.

Change-Id: Ia1aeabcdcf021943ebb7a4e35939c383ac820b19
Closes-Bug: #1809121
(cherry picked from commit 65b21e7f9de7f5a465dd4c5d921ac476d8e1500a)

commit_message:
Fix images minimum ram and disk default values

When uploading an image, if we do not set a minimum ram and disk size we
try to send "None" to glance.
We should instead send "0" and glance will calculate the size from the
provided image.

Change-Id: Ia1aeabcdcf021943ebb7a4e35939c383ac820b19
Closes-Bug: #1809121
(cherry picked from commit 65b21e7f9de7f5a465dd4c5d921ac476d8e1500a)

commit_message:
Fix image_name retrieval in custom-image jobs

And use a 'file://' url for the custom manila image.

See also https://review.openstack.org/#/c/623330.  These
are interdependent patches but no harm is done by merging
this one first and having 623330 depend on it since retrieval
of the image name is not working correctly anyways.

Partial-Bug: #1807969

commit_message:
Add cache configuration for ceilometer project

when using ceilometer+gnocchi, for every notification sample, ceilometer
will update the resource even if is not updated.

We should add [cache] section to make ceilometer cache the resource, and
stop send the useless update request.

Closes-Bug: #1807841
Change-Id: Ic33b4cd5ba8165c20878cab068f38a3948c9d31d
(cherry picked from commit 55bf29ec6c459dc46cefdee69acb8e427763e409)

Spice console doesn't work on aarch64+kvm.

But neither does using serial console.

If anyone else is keen on giving it a try too, then please do."}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-12-20 14:52:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-12-20 14:53:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-12-20 14:57:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-12-20 14:57:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-12-20 14:59:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 16011, 'date': '2018-12-25 19:47:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: Code-Review+1

First of all, great job on this patchset! Thanks for putting it together so quickly.

I was able to successfully test this patch with only a couple of minor hiccups. Namely, the OVS provider bridge is not automatically created on the bare metal hosts during the upgrade process. This is not your fault; it was not introduced to the role until Rocky. That said, the play should complete successfully, but the provider bridge will not be available and the Open vSwitch agent will continuously restart until it exists. This means that traffic thru the new bare metal agents (l3/dhcp) will not work post-upgrade until that is resolved. 

Prior to running cleanup-neutron.yml, I ran the following:

ansible infra1,infra2,infra3 -m shell -a 'ovs-vsctl add-br br-provider'
ansible infra1,infra2,infra3 -m shell -a 'ovs-vsctl add-port br-provider br-vlan'

The agent should stabilize on its own. Some of the port in the integration bridge show up in vlan 4095 and the port state is BINDING_FAILED or unbound. I was able to recover these ports by bouncing them using 'openstack port set --disable/--enable <port-id>'.

We can chat more about this after the holidays!"}, {'account_id': 16011, 'date': '2018-12-25 19:50:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: -Code-Review

Let me clarify that my test case was Pike+OVS -> Queens+OVS. The patchset as-is may completely address LinuxBridge deployments. I don't have the time to verify at the moment."}, {'account_id': 21369, 'date': '2018-12-27 09:33:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

> First of all, great job on this patchset! Thanks for putting it
 > together so quickly.
 > 
 > I was able to successfully test this patch with only a couple of
 > minor hiccups. Namely, the OVS provider bridge is not automatically
 > created on the bare metal hosts during the upgrade process. This is
 > not your fault; it was not introduced to the role until Rocky. That
 > said, the play should complete successfully, but the provider
 > bridge will not be available and the Open vSwitch agent will
 > continuously restart until it exists. This means that traffic thru
 > the new bare metal agents (l3/dhcp) will not work post-upgrade
 > until that is resolved.
 > 
 > Prior to running cleanup-neutron.yml, I ran the following:
 > 
 > ansible infra1,infra2,infra3 -m shell -a 'ovs-vsctl add-br
 > br-provider'
 > ansible infra1,infra2,infra3 -m shell -a 'ovs-vsctl add-port
 > br-provider br-vlan'
 > 
 > The agent should stabilize on its own. Some of the port in the
 > integration bridge show up in vlan 4095 and the port state is
 > BINDING_FAILED or unbound. I was able to recover these ports by
 > bouncing them using 'openstack port set --disable/--enable
 > <port-id>'.
 > 
 > We can chat more about this after the holidays!

We also created the ovs bridge manually during the update. We did it because before it was also part of our preperation steps for the neutron agents containers. I think, this was mentioned in the docs as prerequisite."}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2019-01-03 09:10:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

[{'created': '2018-12-14 18:59:51.000000000', 'message': 'Add automated migration of neutron agents to bare metal

on its own.

implemented in a follow up patch if need be. The related bug below
provides the requisite database change, but I do not have a test
environment which can verify any other steps that may be required.

commit_message:
Add automated migration of neutron agents to bare metal

In Id16b1bcd67bf075a8677206a205ece010e7b014c the environment files
were changed in order to ensure that new deployments have neutron
agents on the bare metal host, not in containers. However, after
upgrading from P to Q the agents are still in a container and it
was left to the deployer to figure out how to do the migration.

With thanks to the co-authors this process has now been worked out
and this patch adds automation for that process to make it simpler
for deployers.

Note that there is no rebalancing implemented. It seems that if the
default deployment settings are used, neutron handles the rebalancing
on its own.

Also note that no neutron lbaasv2 changes are included - this can be
implemented in a follow up patch if need be. The related bug below
provides the requisite database change, but I do not have a test
environment which can verify any other steps that may be required.

Change-Id: I88836acef3d4033f9b887093f44e7089c92bbe6f
Co-Authored-By: Daniel Marks <daniel.marks@codecentric.de>
Co-Authored-By: Christian Zunker <christian.zunker@codecentric.de>
Co-Authored-By: James Denton <james.denton@rackspace.com>
Closes-Bug: #1785592
Related-Bug: #1804770

commit_message:
Convert hyphens to underscores for service names

The Chef Style Guide[1] does not recommend using hyphens for cookbook or
resource names. To maintain consistency, we should follow best
practices.

In order to pass Zuul's one-way CRD requirements[2], both hyphens and
underscores must exist for a compatibility period.

[1]: https://docs.chef.io/ruby.html#use-of-hyphens
[2]: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-February/056515.html

Change-Id: Ic2b6d8f1cdf719791faaebdbd7e29e789eb3f31c

commit_message:
Auto-load VIRTHOST variable when defined

Instead of failing to run due to missing target hostname, quickstart.sh
is not using VIRTHOST environment variable if defined.

And informative information message is included when this happens.

If the variable is not defined it still fails.

All error/notice messages (logging) are now send to stderr instead of
stdout as POSIX recommands (previously only some were).

Change-Id: Iadf315c14c98f4ca48b96d516d3af212e6596287

commit_message:
Make scenario001-standalone job voting

The scenario001-standalone job is added with [1] and is replacing
the scenario001-multinode on master. This makes it voting. Tracked
by ci squad with [2]. The job looks stable currently [3]

[1] https://github.com/openstack-infra/tripleo-ci/commit/d6abc5029f05b777b01baf5bae1365017185cd2e#diff-529817c5b37a6a56e3df2453f56177e1

definitions in undercloud.conf.

legacy DhcpStart | DhcpEnd parameters.

Closes-Bug: #1807707

commit_message:
Use calculated undercloud ctlplane DHCP allocation pools

Change: I4ba148f465b4c452bd5b2c31009ac8a2897bcd5f makes
dhcp_start and dhcp_end optional for non-local subnet
definitions in undercloud.conf.

Start using the AllocationPools parameter istead of the
legacy DhcpStart | DhcpEnd parameters.

Closes-Bug: #1806512
Closes-Bug: #1807707
Depends-On: I4ba148f465b4c452bd5b2c31009ac8a2897bcd5f
Change-Id: Ifdf3e9d22766c1b5ede151979b93754a3d244cc3

commit_message:
Catch heat exceptions in DeployStackAction

The stack creation and update can fail with validation errors, catch the
errors to propagate them properly to the client.

Change-Id: I6b723b703b5a931851759d71242868394ce00066
Closes-Bug: #1800493
(cherry picked from commit 51519d78b604c3bf4515bd289e561cfa2655eceb)

commit_message:
ovn-metadata: Fix bug when upgrading

When the upgrade tasks are run, there's a bug in the docker
service file for OVN metadata when trying to figure out if
it was previously enabled by systemd as it's using the wrong
variable name.

NOTE: This was not caught by CI as upgrade jobs were run
against ML2/OVS.

Change-Id: I0543a84892097d788e813f4c0404078891999ce5
Closes-Bug: #1809645
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Allow separate listen port in haproxy-config templates

This allows a service to pass in a different listening port than haproxy
listens on for the service. This allows haproxy to live on the same
network interface as the services, and will be used by services in
subsequent changes.

Change-Id: Id1d2429a4c800628cb43e0fb7d2b69131e71ee1c
Implements: blueprint service-hostnames

commit_message:
Add local filesystem certficiate options to common config

Currently, config options in certificates/common/local.py does not emit when
oslo-config-generator used since list_opts() only care about the certificates
variable in common config.

It confuses operators who want to check the options using generation step.
Add the options to common certificates in order to auto-generate.

Change-Id: Ic4b1119e0ed724643873505bab3002c92b7a883f
Story: 2004680
Tasks: 28672

commit_message:
Remove the dependency on SSH for monitors

To detect if we can copy keyrings off a monitor, we do not need to
introduce a hard dependency on SSH contact, we only need to ensure
that the ansible has a working execution path to the monitor over
what ever connection plugin is used.

Change-Id: Idb9a178ca2165920804eee12a54419722aa64f51
(cherry picked from commit f8187bda2cb7bdc306e09f369ecbed15fba1e041)

testcase and skip re-expanding the -ui/-dashboard renaming
for the python- subpackage.

commit_message:
Revert "added regex rule for horizon dashboard packages for suse"

The regex rule does not work correctly and it's difficult to make it
work with the dashboard packages and 3rd party deps.

This reverts commit adefeddaa58c9cc104560eef75e773e1ec6e9d88 and

commit_message:
Remove stale pip-missing-reqs tox test

pip_missing_reqs tool is no longer maintained and has broken with
release 10 of pip

Refer to:
 http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/130027.html

Change-Id: I1b02384494ae9f440b72b98d9ae5f31d88dc8967

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-29 22:57:52.000000000', 'message': "cleanup: stop setting priority in a follow-up task

We can set priority directly inside the yum_repository module
therefore there's no need for us to actually set it in a follow-up
task that's not idempotent.

Change-Id: Ie5ae5c051055ed532b3ae9dd64c2cb3d15c7173a
"}]
commit_message:
cleanup: stop setting priority in a follow-up task

We can set priority directly inside the yum_repository module
therefore there's no need for us to actually set it in a follow-up
task that's not idempotent.

Change-Id: Ie5ae5c051055ed532b3ae9dd64c2cb3d15c7173a

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-29 22:54:42.000000000', 'message': "cleanup: stop installing mysql headers

Due to the fact that we use pyMySQL which is a pure Python
implementation of MySQL, we don't need to install the development
headers because we don't build MySQL-Python anywhere.

Change-Id: I57246c0a0538ccfd621a79454a8f9b5a21c65422
"}]
commit_message:
cleanup: stop installing mysql headers

Due to the fact that we use pyMySQL which is a pure Python
implementation of MySQL, we don't need to install the development
headers because we don't build MySQL-Python anywhere.

Change-Id: I57246c0a0538ccfd621a79454a8f9b5a21c65422

commit_message:
Remove docs, deprecated hooks, tests

Remove all deprecated hooks and tests.
Also since all test and hooks are removed,
we can remove the declare of python language in classifier.
Since we didn't actually provide any document,
we should remove docs too.

Hooks are maintained as Agents under heat-agents repo now.
Hooks in heat-templates are deprecated for a while. Hence, remove
hooks in heat-templates.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/584774/
Change-Id: Ia886f71eaf99d75db0f9a6a7dfbe8664995c26e7

commit_message:
Fix neutron log path

Log path for neutron services are not properly configured to be
read by fluentd. The neutron-api, neutron-l3, neutron-metadata and
neutron-ovs-agent services path should start with 'neutron-'
currently they are are not.

This patch adds the neutron- prefix to the log file name.

Enable fluentd on scenraio001-multinode-containers, as it's
disabled
Change-Id: Ia8cec19db316e87ca1e06701161567f11e8c79f4

commit_message:
Exit wait_for_stack_does_not_exist if the status is delete failed

The current implementation waits for 10 minutes, regardless of the stack
status. This will exit earlier and fail the workflow, triggering the
error handling in the delete_stack workflow.

Change-Id: I1c38e9c4f1c8e5a7be8a354549ebfdcbd2e822cd
Closes-Bug: #1777074

commit_message:
Lint fixes for ci-scripts and config folders

This normalizes the formatting of files from ci-scripts and config
folders in order to allow further hardening of linting.

Fixing linting was too big to be made in a single commit as it would
involve too many files to review and could merge conflicts with
existing changes. Thus doing it in few chunks would makes it possible.

Original full change is at https://review.openstack.org/#/c/627545/ and
will be the one merging the last.

Change-Id: Ifb215c0e2ea0ef7115897721f75ba8489bd59b97

Remove non-container zaqar-server on upgrade

This removes the zaqar websocket service on upgrade from
non-containerized environment, in particular the undercloud.

Change-Id: If2151c27bfdf4e1f1a22704221c1a2c75aa9cf0a
Closes-Bug: #1798546
(cherry picked from commit b56ae5774f0018d12246c4b60e676cc20c28d9e2)

commit_message:
Add deprecated_server_resource_name for ObjectStorage role

The ObjectStorage role has been renamed in the past from SwiftStorage,
and we need to add this as a deprecated server resource name.

Co-Authored-By: Marius Cornea <mcornea@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix the scenario007 CI job failure

scenario007 CI job which enables OVN, is failing with the error
'Property DockerCinderConfigImage not assigned'.

docker-ha.yaml defines the cinder pacemaker service. This patch undefines
the cinder services in scenari007 file.

Change-Id: Ic743377c075c9a6f9a84fb13e35f0c1f29ff7228

commit_message:
Don't require files key in env-generator

We have environments that are exclusively resource_registry entries,
and we shouldn't have to include a dummy files: key to make that
work with the generator.

Change-Id: I8ffabb5e583aabbfa4f2f22a4418783c857118fa

commit_message:
Align novajoin container logging to other services

novajoin container was logging to stdout, not to a file in
bind mounted '/var/log/container' like other services
in tripleo.

Closes-Bug: #1796658
Change-Id: I6614f5d749b65401c44fe5a7dc98f56d55aaf6c1
