revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-04 01:40:57.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I347442f4859b8be127530a0e66efad48383552b9
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}, {'created': '2018-12-03 15:08:13.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I347442f4859b8be127530a0e66efad48383552b9
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I347442f4859b8be127530a0e66efad48383552b9
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

Simplify some scripts and remove some unnecessary jq usage

jq is powerful tool but in some points it's kind of overkill and jq
can be replaced by simple openstack command with appropriate options.

Change-Id: I5cb09b953d725482a525be16be31f0e2ecf42966

commit_message:
Format json attributes in resource show

When performing an openstack stack resource show, several of the
attributes printed are in json format, but are not printed in a
user friendly way. This patch formats these attributes and prints
them properly.

Change-Id: I0400431868398a5c7f3cdf01673f62c0c45977d5
Blueprint: heat-support-python-openstackclient

commit_message:
Changed the message when deleting volumes

Added functionality to the handle function in the BatchAction class
in action.py and allowed the easy changing between the alert types
and made deleting images, instances, and volumes give an info alert
rather than a success message and altered the testing parameters

Change-Id: I68450fe0f98e5ca8b41f16df09acff76126151d1
Closes-Bug: #1291681

[{'created': '2018-11-21 15:48:13.000000000', 'message': 'Disable deprecated parameter ControllerEnableSwiftStorage

Setting this parameter to False not only breaks the deployment, but also
disables important storage services on storage nodes, not only
Controllers.

The parameter has been marked deprecated for quite awhile, thus changing

commit_message:
Disable deprecated parameter ControllerEnableSwiftStorage

Setting this parameter to False not only breaks the deployment, but also
disables important storage services on storage nodes, not only
Controllers.

The parameter has been marked deprecated for quite awhile, thus changing
it to be non-effective (before removing it totally).

Closes-Bug: 1804479

Change-Id: I30bdc60853b6057f4f7c8c28dc88e6b151056422

Fix ad hoc commands executed by AnsibleAction.run() when command is not
passed as a dict() but as a normal string, the same way like ordinary
ansible command works.
Check if argument is a dict() and only if it is, use json.dumps() on it.

Closes-bug: 1805342
'}]
commit_message:
Fix AnsibleAction.run() when argument is not a dict

Fix ad hoc commands executed by AnsibleAction.run() when command is not
passed as a dict() but as a normal string, the same way like ordinary
ansible command works.
Check if argument is a dict() and only if it is, use json.dumps() on it.
And not break commands passed as string.

Change-Id: I8b18658bfbae57f264db007e5e81556b0512ef55
Closes-bug: 1805342

commit_message:
Process the templates even if j2_excludes file is not present

It is possible to use the process_templates script to generate the
user's jinja templates based on role and network data. But the script
expects the presence of j2_excludes file. Making it as optional, allows
users to generate templates in user's template directory itself, like

  $ /usr/share/openstack-tripleo-heat-templates/tools/process-templates.py \
         -p ~/templates/ \
         -r ~/templates/roles_data.yaml \
         -n ~/templates/network_data.yaml

Closes-Bug: #1806351
Change-Id: I375cd9ff9b40bbdad34d0732ec8abd25fbdde46e

messages:
[{'account_id': 27660, 'date': '2018-01-17 02:05:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-01-17 02:06:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html

commit_message:
SG creation user taken straight to edit rules

When the user creates a security group they are taken straight to
manage security group and can select and make changes to rules.

Uncovered a bug in Python 2.7 tests that was fixed as well

closes-bug: #1292084

Change-Id: Id4e80dadaa7e6d1a7f3bb621949ef736007162c9

* Update ironic from 11.1.0 to 11.1.1

* Update octavia from 3.0.1 to 3.0.2

> (1 comment)

No I only confirmed config parsing with spaces in values worked as documented. There were no details or bugs linked in the commit message so there was no other information to go on. This is actually a bug in stestr because spaces in paths aren't a common thing on unix filesystems. So when it subprocess out it assumes the path doesn't have spaces, it's fixable there by just escaping the path in stestr. Can you open a bug about this in stestr here: https://github.com/mtreinish/stestr/issues"}, {'account_id': 8911, 'date': '2019-01-03 03:50:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> (1 comment)
 No worries, I understand that I didn't provide enough information. I just I thought that since I met this very often, everyone knows that :) Ok I'll open a bug in stestr and provide a pull request. But I think it's good to have the fix for tempest too."}, {'account_id': 8911, 'date': '2019-01-03 04:52:59.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Due to fixing in stestr: https://github.com/mtreinish/stestr/issues/211'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-02 18:04:09.000000000', 'message': "Quote dirs in .stestr.conf file

`tempest init` command generates `.stestr.conf` file and doesn't quote
the paths in `test_path` and `top_dir` and the `tempest run` doesn't work
in the directories which contain a space in the name.
So put the paths in quotes fix this problem.

Change-Id: Iab6862b2560ddedb752e6b2c6ea90d1de13d9b01
"}]
commit_message:
Quote dirs in .stestr.conf file

`tempest init` command generates `.stestr.conf` file and doesn't quote
the paths in `test_path` and `top_dir` and the `tempest run` doesn't work
in the directories which contain a space in the name.
So put the paths in quotes fix this problem.

Change-Id: Iab6862b2560ddedb752e6b2c6ea90d1de13d9b01

subject: Convert template setup to a role
messages: [{'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2019-01-03 00:45:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2019-01-03 01:02:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2019-01-03 02:38:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2019-01-03 03:59:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-03 00:45:20.000000000', 'message': 'Convert template setup to a role

This change reduces code throughout the playbooks thereby speeding up
the task execution. A new role named `elastic_beat_setup` was created to
facilitate template setup as needed. Beats retention policies are all
now defined and setup on the elastic-logstash nodes instead of on all
target hosts. This method will speed-up deployments on massive
installations while streamlining all deployments.

Change-Id: I36343264042e81dfcb68bad0f6c3a503e525eceb
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}, {'created': '2019-01-03 01:02:41.000000000', 'message': 'Convert template setup to a role

This change reduces code throughout the playbooks thereby speeding up
the task execution.
  * A new role named `elastic_beat_setup` was created to
    facilitate template setup as needed.
  * Beats retention policies are now defined on the elastic-logstash
    nodes instead of on all target hosts. This method will speed-up
    deployments on massive installations while streamlining all deployments.
  * Kibana variable assumptions have been fixed. This will allow for
    deployments without Kibana to be accomplished.

Change-Id: I36343264042e81dfcb68bad0f6c3a503e525eceb
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}, {'created': '2019-01-03 02:38:55.000000000', 'message': 'Convert template setup to a role

This change reduces code throughout the playbooks thereby speeding up
the task execution.
  * A new role named `elastic_beat_setup` was created to
    facilitate template setup as needed.
  * Beats retention policies are now defined on the elastic-logstash
    nodes instead of on all target hosts. This method will speed-up
    deployments on massive installations while streamlining all deployments.
  * Kibana variable assumptions have been fixed. This will allow for
    deployments without Kibana to be accomplished.

Change-Id: I36343264042e81dfcb68bad0f6c3a503e525eceb
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Convert template setup to a role

This change reduces code throughout the playbooks thereby speeding up
the task execution.
  * A new role named `elastic_beat_setup` was created to
    facilitate template setup as needed.
  * Beats retention policies are now defined on the elastic-logstash
    nodes instead of on all target hosts. This method will speed-up
    deployments on massive installations while streamlining all deployments.
  * Kibana variable assumptions have been fixed. This will allow for
    deployments without Kibana to be accomplished.

Change-Id: I36343264042e81dfcb68bad0f6c3a503e525eceb
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Add relnotes for ODL migration to diagstatus API

Add release notes for migration from old OpenDaylight netvirt:1
healthcheck REST API to new diagstatus API.

Code change was merged here, but I didn't know to add relnotes.

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/621052

Change-Id: Iacdcf3f962c61890dc47f523911698b5f4696381
Signed-off-by: Daniel Farrell <dfarrell@redhat.com>

[{'created': '2018-12-18 09:01:45.000000000', 'message': 'Remove unused nova packages from host during upgrade and update

As of now, during to upgrade from pike -> queens or doing
minor update on queens deployment, the nova packages upgrade
on compute node changes the permissions on /var/lib/nova from
42436 (container nova uid) to 162 (host nova uid) which
prevents user from creating instances with permission Error.

This change handles removing unused nova packages from compute
host during major upgrade from pike -> queens as well as during
minor update on queens deployment.

Change-Id: I7e7167252f08f5df555912e0692f33649228fc83
'}, {'created': '2018-12-20 06:52:14.000000000', 'message': 'Remove unused nova packages from host during upgrade and update

As of now, during to upgrade from pike -> queens or doing
minor update on pike/queens deployment, the nova packages upgrade
on compute node changes the permissions on /var/lib/nova tree from
42436 (container nova uid) to 162 (host nova uid) which
prevents user from creating instances with permission Error.

This change handles removing unused nova packages from compute
host during major upgrade as well as minor update on explicitly.

Change-Id: I7e7167252f08f5df555912e0692f33649228fc83
'}]
commit_message:
Remove unused nova packages from host during upgrade and update

As of now, during to upgrade from pike -> queens or doing
minor update on pike/queens deployment, the nova packages upgrade
on compute node changes the permissions on /var/lib/nova tree from
42436 (container nova uid) to 162 (host nova uid) which
prevents user from creating instances with permission Error.

This change handles removing unused nova packages from compute
host during major upgrade as well as minor update on explicitly.

Change-Id: I7e7167252f08f5df555912e0692f33649228fc83

subject: Fix fact gathering with --limit
messages: [{'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-12-20 09:28:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-12-20 10:16:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 19930, 'date': '2018-12-20 10:47:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 19316, 'date': '2019-01-02 10:12:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 23717, 'date': '2019-01-03 03:45:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-20 09:28:25.000000000', 'message': 'Fix fact gathering with --limit

Prior to this change, when the --limit argument is used, each host in the
limit gathers facts for every other host. This is clearly unnecessary, and
can result in up to (N-1)^2 fact gathers.

This change gathers facts for each host only once. Hosts that are not in
the limit are divided between those that are in the limit, and facts are
gathered via delegation.

This change also factors out the fact gathering logic into a separate
playbook that is imported where necessary.

Change-Id: I923df5af41a7f1b7b0142d0da185a9a0979be543
(cherry picked from commit 56b4352f9edd23c38bb24ff6eaec6748858e3e9f)
'}, {'created': '2018-12-20 10:16:02.000000000', 'message': 'Fix fact gathering with --limit

Prior to this change, when the --limit argument is used, each host in the
limit gathers facts for every other host. This is clearly unnecessary, and
can result in up to (N-1)^2 fact gathers.

This change gathers facts for each host only once. Hosts that are not in
the limit are divided between those that are in the limit, and facts are
gathered via delegation.

This change also factors out the fact gathering logic into a separate
playbook that is imported where necessary.

Change-Id: I923df5af41a7f1b7b0142d0da185a9a0979be543

commit_message:
Fix fact gathering with --limit

Prior to this change, when the --limit argument is used, each host in the
limit gathers facts for every other host. This is clearly unnecessary, and
can result in up to (N-1)^2 fact gathers.

This change gathers facts for each host only once. Hosts that are not in
the limit are divided between those that are in the limit, and facts are
gathered via delegation.

This change also factors out the fact gathering logic into a separate
playbook that is imported where necessary.

Change-Id: I923df5af41a7f1b7b0142d0da185a9a0979be543
(cherry picked from commit 56b4352f9edd23c38bb24ff6eaec6748858e3e9f)

commit_message:
Drop nose dependencies

Horizon test setting no longer depends on nose and related stuffs.
This commit cleans up nose related dependencies.

Filenames of test modules need to start with test_*
so that Django test runner detects them.
There is no test defined but it would be nice to adjust the filename.

Also moves horizon dependencies to requirements.txt.

Change-Id: Ib2f246d76da8a1f5d26a9cf8e9ef27e5f4f62bee

commit_message:
Enable disablereuse option in Zaqar proxy backend

Modify the Zaqar mod_proxy backend to use use the parameter
disablereuse=On, disabling the ability to reuse connections to the
proxy backend.  This is necessary to prevent reuse of connections by
mod_proxy to the backend Zaqar WebSocket server when the Zaqar
WebSocket server closes the socket on its own, that mod_proxy
occasionally expects to be open.  This creates a new connection with
every request.

Change-Id: Id5f22d8682805566eadd8205a5aa88524ce94b80
Closes-Bug: #1803422
(cherry picked from commit d4c98bd2c615cc3ac6546cea6814b113c352a8d3)

commit_message:
Remove tftp service and package upon upgrade to container

In non-containerized over/undercloud, the tftpd service is
supervised by xinetd.
If we don't deactivate tftpd from xinetd, the UDP:69 port
will still be in use, preventing the containerized tftpd
service to start.

Change-Id: Ibf2decaaaedda9a3b44f28786a5ab9b7415a3907
Closes-bug: 1783547
(cherry picked from commit 149ca6e1634de629a90026a547f301c59555725f)

messages: [{'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-11-22 11:03:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-11-22 11:05:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 8042, 'date': '2018-11-22 11:11:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 8042, 'date': '2018-11-23 10:06:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nrecheck -- that job passed on the patch on top of this one'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2019-01-02 10:28:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-22 11:03:45.000000000', 'message': "Fix ironic containers data owning races

Complements I5ad4956174346f0$24945852da09f3841c3378c2b.
Fix ironic_pxe/inspector containers missing the kolla_config sections
to recursively chown /var/lib/ironic* shared paths. That removes data
owning races across other ironic containers starting on earlier or the
same steps/order.

For example, when ironic_pxe_http fails to access the
/var/lib/ironic/httpboot path shared with ironic_conductor, the latter
reports errors like:

DriverLoadError: Driver, hardware type or interface ilo-pxe could not
be loaded. Reason: [Errno 13] Permission denied:
'/var/lib/ironic/httpboot/...

Fixing the dir owner allows HW provisioning to complete w/o such
errors.

Change-Id: I34b54077c1c610a4bed73129e9784b2fa353e944
Closes-bug: #1783762
(cherry picked from commit 9d9daebdda3093e795b83075349b12d23f9241e8)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix ironic containers data owning races

Complements I5ad4956174346f0$24945852da09f3841c3378c2b.
Fix ironic_pxe/inspector containers missing the kolla_config sections
to recursively chown /var/lib/ironic* shared paths. That removes data
owning races across other ironic containers starting on earlier or the
same steps/order.

For example, when ironic_pxe_http fails to access the
/var/lib/ironic/httpboot path shared with ironic_conductor, the latter
reports errors like:

DriverLoadError: Driver, hardware type or interface ilo-pxe could not
be loaded. Reason: [Errno 13] Permission denied:
'/var/lib/ironic/httpboot/...

Fixing the dir owner allows HW provisioning to complete w/o such
errors.

Change-Id: I34b54077c1c610a4bed73129e9784b2fa353e944
Closes-bug: #1783762
(cherry picked from commit 9d9daebdda3093e795b83075349b12d23f9241e8)

commit_message:
Fix ServiceData in docker/services/aodh-api.yaml

The puppet aodh-api.yaml service uses the puppet
apache service. The apache server uses the cidr
map in ServiceData.

The docker service did not pass the ServiceData
to the puppet service template. The result is
that the properties resolved to ''.

Related-Bug: #1806718
Change-Id: I736e0fa4191fa130f882b09eb87256c62ac69143
(cherry picked from commit 66142908cf85a8e2c1cd502103df6296eea8b1d1)

commit_message:
Include octavia::controller

Commits https://review.openstack.org/#/c/612395/ and
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/619013/ deprecated some
parameters in class octavia::worker and moved them to the new class
octavia::controller. The latter commit also removed the include of the
controller class so because of that we have to include it in the Octavia
services manifest files in puppet-tripleo.

Partial-Bug: #1805345

Change-Id: I0256e125de367615c21343683ed5311521d8337c
(cherry picked from commit 43ffaed334e0cdf34329972085ffadd7a2fa1ba0)

Other Octavia services like octavia-worker also require setting of

commit_message:
Fix misnaming of service in firewall rule

On Octavia-enabled composable role deployments where the Octavia health
manager service doesn't run co-located with the API service, the
firewall rule to allow messages in to the o-hm0 interface was not being
created. As a result of that, the load balancers were not going ONLINE.

    puppet/services/octavia-health-manager.yaml

[{'account_id': 28627, 'date': '2018-09-05 14:15:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-09-05 14:15:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html

commit_message:
Cinder-type param is_public/access_project_ids

Added parameters is_public
  - allow create public or private cinder type
  boolean: Default to true
Added propertie access_project_ids
  - Specify list of project ids which have
  access to private cinder type

Change-Id: I7f6aac76b441cb4ac4901901c6d894a1c920d399

[{'created': '2018-12-30 10:55:22.000000000', 'message': 'Set absolute path for docker entrypoint

If another docker will use us as a base image, and then set the WORKDIR
to something else than /opt/dragonflow, the call to run_dragonflow.sh will fail
as it will not be found.

Change-Id: If9f25f94520fd74ab14658cf63f43c940da7b2ea
'}, {'created': '2018-12-30 14:02:20.000000000', 'message': 'Set absolute path for docker entrypoint

If another docker will use us as a base image, and then set the WORKDIR
to something else than /opt/dragonflow, the call to run_dragonflow.sh will fail
as it will not be found.

Change-Id: If9f25f94520fd74ab14658cf63f43c940da7b2ea
'}, {'created': '2019-01-02 06:23:01.000000000', 'message': 'Set absolute path for docker entrypoint

In case dragonflow is used as a base image for another docker image, and the
WORKDIR is set to something other than /opt/dragonflow before running the
container, the call to run_dragonflow.sh will fail as the reference is relative
so it will not be found.

Change-Id: If9f25f94520fd74ab14658cf63f43c940da7b2ea
'}]
commit_message:
Set absolute path for docker entrypoint

In case dragonflow is used as a base image for another docker image, and the
WORKDIR is set to something other than /opt/dragonflow before running the
container, the call to run_dragonflow.sh will fail as the reference is relative
so it will not be found.

Change-Id: If9f25f94520fd74ab14658cf63f43c940da7b2ea

commit_message:
Do state report after setting start_flag on OVS restart

This fixes race condition leading to lack of fdb entries
on agent after OVS restart, if agent managed to handle all ports
before sending state report with start_flag set to True.

Change-Id: I943f8d805630cdfbefff9cff1fb4bce89210618b
Closes-Bug: #1808136
(cherry picked from commit 3995abefb16181594181133b271cdf35fa8d9937)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-30 15:12:59.000000000', 'message': 'Use libeatmydata during nspawn cache prep

The nspawn cache prep is timing out regularly so use eatmydata to minimise
pressure on the filesystem during package installation.

dpkg calls fsync for each file installed from each package which can
result in very poor performance on some filesystems. This patch gives
around a 4x improvement in "slow" gate runs, and 2x on esxi hdd storage.

Change-Id: I80efd3f8044f377a497492f09689c459c6094742
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
Co-authored-by: Jonathan Rosser <jonathan.rosser@rd.bbc.co.uk>
'}, {'created': '2019-01-02 18:03:00.000000000', 'message': 'Use libeatmydata during nspawn cache prep

pressure on the filesystem during package installation.

dpkg calls fsync for each file installed from each package which can
result in very poor performance on some filesystems. This patch gives
around a 4x improvement in "slow" gate runs, and 2x on esxi hdd storage.

Change-Id: I80efd3f8044f377a497492f09689c459c6094742
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
Co-authored-by: Jonathan Rosser <jonathan.rosser@rd.bbc.co.uk>

commit_message:
Use libeatmydata during nspawn cache prep

The nspawn cache prep is timing out regularly so use eatmydata to minimise
pressure on the filesystem during package installation.

dpkg calls fsync for each file installed from each package which can
result in very poor performance on some filesystems. This patch gives
around a 4x improvement in "slow" gate runs, and 2x on esxi hdd storage.

Change-Id: I80efd3f8044f377a497492f09689c459c6094742
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
Co-authored-by: Jonathan Rosser <jonathan.rosser@rd.bbc.co.uk>

commit_message:
use neutron-lib for _model_query

The model_query module is in neutron-lib and the CommonDBMixin will
eventually be removed. This patch swiches use of the _model_query
method over to query_with_hooks from neutron-lib.

Change-Id: Iab0dbf545c7bc949074a93fed7cbc4a263b9b655

commit_message:
Add cluster_members_addr parameter to specify ip addresses used in cluster setup

Due to https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1659389 we need to be
able to specify the exact ip addresses being used in the cluster setup.
This support exists also for corosync 2.x based systems, but seems to be
quite a necessity when using corosync 3.x + knet. So let's add this
feature in order to cover for the next Centos/RHEL release.

Change-Id: I03d23177c7a913127ffc2f6d01a6318cb80d09c5

subject: Adds get_amphora_stats to the service client
messages:
[{'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2018-07-24 00:31:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2018-07-24 00:31:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2018-07-24 01:46:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2018-07-24 21:50:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2018-10-16 01:02:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2018-10-16 01:02:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Patch Set 3 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2018-10-16 16:10:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2018-10-16 22:08:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 6579, 'date': '2018-12-09 16:50:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

Hey ZhaoBo,

I'm aware that this patch depends on other patches, but I gave it a couple of comments that can be fixed regardless (related to tests).



****

Since no test is currently using this function, I modified a test locally so I can play with this: https://pastebin.com/6Ac1wwyD

So with return_object_only=True (default)

(Pdb) self.os_admin.amphora_client.get_amphora_stats(amphora_id=amp_id)
*** KeyError: 'amphora_stats'

I see amphora_stats declared here[1].

and: with return_object_only=False

(Pdb) self.os_admin.amphora_client.get_amphora_stats(amphora_id=amp_id, return_object_only=False)
{u'amphora': {}}

Which we don't expect to be empty.

Looking deeper I see that the request[2] return the expected data, but without stats:

(Pdb) pp self.get(request_uri)
({u'connection': 'close',
  u'content-length': '15',
  'content-location': 'http://192.168.10.6/load-balancer/v2.0/octavia/amphorae/0c5473e5-0026-4877-b6d1-347baebe1909/stats',
  u'content-type': 'application/json',
  u'date': 'Sun, 09 Dec 2018 16:06:12 GMT',
  u'server': 'Apache/2.4.6 (CentOS) OpenSSL/1.0.2k-fips mod_wsgi/3.4 Python/2.7.5',
  'status': '200',
  u'x-openstack-request-id': 'req-14669568-3989-4703-9718-b47a9a937515'},
 '{"amphora": {}}')

So I recalled this[3] patch which should probably be added as Depends-On..

Anyhow, I cherry-picked[3] locally to see if that works, and it did:

(Pdb) pp self.os_admin.amphora_client.get_amphora_stats(amphora_id=u'b1f7459d-8063-4b4c-a1d4-2abea5312a1c', return_object_only=False)
{u'amphora_stats': [{u'active_connections': 0,
                     u'bytes_in': 0,
                     u'bytes_out': 0,
                     u'id': u'b1f7459d-8063-4b4c-a1d4-2abea5312a1c',
                     u'listener_id': u'e36b580a-9025-4579-bd5e-8547b7601017',
                     u'loadbalancer_id': u'5060de46-695f-4924-8bcd-b713eaf20da4',
                     u'request_errors': 0,
                     u'total_connections': 0}]}
(Pdb) pp self.os_admin.amphora_client.get_amphora_stats(amphora_id=amp_id, return_object_only=False)
{u'amphora_stats': [{u'active_connections': 0,
                     u'bytes_in': 0,
                     u'bytes_out': 0,
                     u'id': u'b42fed9b-dc83-4c4f-8204-e3e2b40b7d83',
                     u'listener_id': u'7725c173-e61b-4399-b259-72b0ffc592fa',
                     u'loadbalancer_id': u'367313c5-147a-4215-a106-facae927c5ea',
                     u'request_errors': 0,
                     u'total_connections': 0}]}

I also noticed above that return_object_only did not seem to do the trick.
When I checked inside the func it does seem to work so probably something related to the return statement?

(Pdb) pp json.loads(body.decode('utf-8'))
{u'amphora_stats': [{u'active_connections': 0,
                     u'bytes_in': 0,
                     u'bytes_out': 0,
                     u'id': u'b42fed9b-dc83-4c4f-8204-e3e2b40b7d83',
                     u'listener_id': u'7725c173-e61b-4399-b259-72b0ffc592fa',
                     u'loadbalancer_id': u'367313c5-147a-4215-a106-facae927c5ea',
                     u'request_errors': 0,
                     u'total_connections': 0}]}
(Pdb) pp json.loads(body.decode('utf-8'))[self.stats_root_tag]
[{u'active_connections': 0,
  u'bytes_in': 0,
  u'bytes_out': 0,
  u'id': u'b42fed9b-dc83-4c4f-8204-e3e2b40b7d83',
  u'listener_id': u'7725c173-e61b-4399-b259-72b0ffc592fa',
  u'loadbalancer_id': u'367313c5-147a-4215-a106-facae927c5ea',
  u'request_errors': 0,
  u'total_connections': 0}]



[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/585060/5/octavia_tempest_plugin/services/load_balancer/v2/amphora_client.py@28
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/585060/5/octavia_tempest_plugin/services/load_balancer/v2/amphora_client.py@154
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/585031/'}, {'account_id': 6579, 'date': '2018-12-09 16:52:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

> Hey ZhaoBo,
 > 
 > I'm aware that this patch depends on other patches, but I gave it a
 > couple of comments that can be fixed regardless (related to tests).
 > 
 > 
 > 
 > ****

commit_message:
Deprecate auth_uri option

Option auth_uri from group keystone_authtoken is deprecated[1].
Use option www_authenticate_uri from group keystone_authtoken.

[1]https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508522/

Change-Id: I68e4c9e81b8f17ec076a03376342e7b166efbe44
Implements: blueprint deprecate-auth-uri-option
(cherry picked from commit f93f485df2ad608ce8a614324a806c8e9c864579)

subject: Prevent using spice console on arm64
messages:
[{'account_id': 29574, 'date': '2018-12-05 13:06:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-12-05 13:06:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2019-01-02 18:08:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2019-01-02 20:27:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-05 13:06:07.000000000', 'message': 'Prevent using spice console on arm64

Currently there is no support for vnc or spice consoles on
arm64 architecture.  Set the default to be serialconsole.

Change-Id: Idd8933cd54194093e635b3e0ba201df275b6f74f
'}]
commit_message:
Prevent using spice console on arm64

Currently there is no support for vnc or spice consoles on
arm64 architecture.  Set the default to be serialconsole.

Change-Id: Idd8933cd54194093e635b3e0ba201df275b6f74f

commit_message:
add release job for osc-summit-counter

Add the job to publish osc-summit-counter to PyPI. The name there is
"openstack-summit-counter", and the project has permission for
openstackci to publish new releases.

Change-Id: I0760def4944ee7582fdfd4c12f1da74772c56b69
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Ignore newly introduced tables in pre-upgrade versions check

The version check is run before tables are created, so it cannot
succeed for them.

Change-Id: Ibcf0728bc5d1b0cbdd78796526f9c93fc99e8c08
Story: #2004589
Task: #28467

commit_message:
Secret payload should also be fetched by UUID

We changed the client to fetch containers and secrets via their UUID
from the API, rather than by HREF, so that the endpoint URLs set in the
keystone client would be respected. Unfortunately, we (I) missed
updating the payload fetch function to do the same. This brings it into
line with the other fetches.

Change-Id: Ic71cf6771563d669a2fa37a56d4b40c637db1511
Story: 2004653
Task: 28608

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-10 23:21:46.000000000', 'message': "More py3.x UT options for tox.ini

Changes the default tox invocation to test py36 instead of py35 per
the Stein supported runtimes proposal [1].

Also adds a py37 option to facilitate future-looking tests per the
resolution on keeping up with Python 3 releases [2].

The py35 option will eventually need to be removed, but this keeps
it for the moment. We're still doing some dev/test on Ubuntu 16.04,
which uses python 3.5 by default.

As previously commented, automatic envs (pyXX) will use the python
version appropriate to that env and ignore basepython inherited from
[testenv], so we no longer specify a basepython explicitly for these.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/611080
[2] https://review.openstack.org/613145

Change-Id: Ia7bc930de383d8522509488194e93e711f51590f
"}, {'created': '2018-12-11 18:01:21.000000000', 'message': 'More py3.x support

The Stein supported runtimes proposal [1] has chosen py36 over py35
due to the communities move to testing on Ubuntu 18.04, where py36
is the default runtime. We update tox.ini and setup.cfg accordingly.

We also add a py37 option to the tox.ini to facilitate future-looking
tests per the resolution on keeping up with Python 3 releases [2].

The py35 option will eventually need to be removed from tox.ini, but
this keeps it for now in order to allow time for folks to transition.

As previously commented, automatic tox envs (pyXX) will use the python
version appropriate to that env and ignore basepython inherited from
[testenv], so we no longer specify a basepython explicitly for these.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/611080
[2] https://review.openstack.org/613145

Change-Id: Ia7bc930de383d8522509488194e93e711f51590f
'}]
commit_message:
More py3.x support

The Stein supported runtimes proposal [1] has chosen py36 over py35
due to the communities move to testing on Ubuntu 18.04, where py36
is the default runtime. We update tox.ini and setup.cfg accordingly.

We also add a py37 option to the tox.ini to facilitate future-looking
tests per the resolution on keeping up with Python 3 releases [2].

The py35 option will eventually need to be removed from tox.ini, but
this keeps it for now in order to allow time for folks to transition.

As previously commented, automatic tox envs (pyXX) will use the python
version appropriate to that env and ignore basepython inherited from
[testenv], so we no longer specify a basepython explicitly for these.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/611080
[2] https://review.openstack.org/613145

Change-Id: Ia7bc930de383d8522509488194e93e711f51590f

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-02 03:46:38.000000000', 'message': "Retry on write conflict when updating SyncPoint

In theory, updating a SyncPoint should never result in a write conflict,
even on a multi-master Galera cluster, because we use UPDATE ... WHERE
(rather than SELECT ... FOR UPDATE). The expected response was for
nothing to get updated, and retries would then happen at the application
level.

However, in the past we have had a number of deadlocks reported by
MariaDB on UPDATE ... WHERE in the gate, and there are still reports of
multi-master Galera clusters running into these 'deadlocks' (which
actually indicate write conflicts in that case).

This change catches any deadlock errors and kicks control back to the
application to handle the retry.

Change-Id: I5d43a50c5d7dcaa18967990cd4f7f2544ff7196f
"}, {'created': '2019-01-02 06:18:24.000000000', 'message': "Retry on write conflict when updating SyncPoint

In theory, updating a SyncPoint should never result in a write conflict,
even on a multi-master Galera cluster, because we use UPDATE ... WHERE
(rather than SELECT ... FOR UPDATE). The expected response was for
nothing to get updated, and retries would then happen at the application
level.

However, in the past we have had a number of deadlocks reported by
MariaDB on UPDATE ... WHERE in the gate, and there are still reports of
multi-master Galera clusters running into these 'deadlocks' (which
actually indicate write conflicts in that case).

This change catches any deadlock errors and kicks control back to the
application to handle the retry.

Change-Id: I5d43a50c5d7dcaa18967990cd4f7f2544ff7196f
"}]
commit_message:
Retry on write conflict when updating SyncPoint

In theory, updating a SyncPoint should never result in a write conflict,
even on a multi-master Galera cluster, because we use UPDATE ... WHERE
(rather than SELECT ... FOR UPDATE). The expected response was for
nothing to get updated, and retries would then happen at the application
level.

However, in the past we have had a number of deadlocks reported by
MariaDB on UPDATE ... WHERE in the gate, and there are still reports of
multi-master Galera clusters running into these 'deadlocks' (which
actually indicate write conflicts in that case).

This change catches any deadlock errors and kicks control back to the
application to handle the retry.

Change-Id: I5d43a50c5d7dcaa18967990cd4f7f2544ff7196f

commit_message:
More py3.x support

The Stein supported runtimes proposal [1] has chosen py36 over py35
due to the communities move to testing on Ubuntu 18.04, where py36
is the default runtime. We update tox.ini and setup.cfg accordingly.

We also add a py37 option to the tox.ini to facilitate future-looking
tests per the resolution on keeping up with Python 3 releases [2].

The py35 option will eventually need to be removed from tox.ini, but
this keeps it for now in order to allow time for folks to transition.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/611080
[2] https://review.openstack.org/613145

Change-Id: Id77fbd969bee5a6f3636be13362a2b89cb5888e8

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-09 02:30:24.000000000', 'message': "More py3.x UT options for tox.ini

Changes the default tox invocation to test py36 instead of py35 per
the Stein supported runtimes proposal [1]. This required changes to
a unit test that previously failed with py36 due to changes in dict
ordering behavior in the newer python interpreter.

Also adds a py37 option to facilitate future-looking tests per the
resolution on keeping up with Python 3 releases [2].

The py35 option will eventually need to be removed, but this keeps
it for the moment. We're still doing some dev/test on Ubuntu 16.04,
which uses python 3.5 by default.

As previously commented, automatic envs (pyXX) will use the python
version appropriate to that env and ignore basepython inherited from
[testenv], so we no longer specify a basepython explicitly for these.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/611080
[2] https://review.openstack.org/613145

Change-Id: Iebdc9357a79cae1923109fb5e37fefb8021af18d

"}, {'created': '2018-12-11 17:00:33.000000000', 'message': 'More py3.x support

The Stein supported runtimes proposal [1] has chosen py36 over py35
due to the communities move to testing on Ubuntu 18.04, where py36
is the default runtime. We update tox.ini and setup.cfg accordingly.

Python 3.6 handles dict order differently than in previous python
versions, so to get py36 to work this uses a sorted() call to make
the behavior consistent across python versions for our network
bridge cleanup and adjusts the corresponding test accordingly.

We also add a py37 option to the tox.ini to facilitate future-looking
tests per the resolution on keeping up with Python 3 releases [2].

The py35 option will eventually need to be removed from tox.ini, but
this keeps it for now in order to allow time for folks to transition.

As previously commented, automatic tox envs (pyXX) will use the python
version appropriate to that env and ignore basepython inherited from
[testenv], so we no longer specify a basepython explicitly for these.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/611080
[2] https://review.openstack.org/613145

Change-Id: Iebdc9357a79cae1923109fb5e37fefb8021af18d
'}]
commit_message:
More py3.x support

The Stein supported runtimes proposal [1] has chosen py36 over py35
due to the communities move to testing on Ubuntu 18.04, where py36
is the default runtime. We update tox.ini and setup.cfg accordingly.

Python 3.6 handles dict order differently than in previous python
versions, so to get py36 to work this uses a sorted() call to make
the behavior consistent across python versions for our network
bridge cleanup and adjusts the corresponding test accordingly.

We also add a py37 option to the tox.ini to facilitate future-looking
tests per the resolution on keeping up with Python 3 releases [2].

The py35 option will eventually need to be removed from tox.ini, but
this keeps it for now in order to allow time for folks to transition.

As previously commented, automatic tox envs (pyXX) will use the python
version appropriate to that env and ignore basepython inherited from
[testenv], so we no longer specify a basepython explicitly for these.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/611080
[2] https://review.openstack.org/613145

Change-Id: Iebdc9357a79cae1923109fb5e37fefb8021af18d

recheck'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2018-10-01 18:54:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16:

With PS15, scenario001 fails [1][2] on the following ceph-ansible task [3]:

- name: set_fact ceph_uid for debian based system - container
  set_fact:
    ceph_uid: 64045
  when:
    - containerized_deployment
    - ceph_docker_image_tag | search("ubuntu")

With the error: 

  The conditional check 'ceph_docker_image_tag | search("ubuntu")' failed.

The ceph_docker_image_tag was correctly set in this job [4].
We have been using ceph-ansible 3.1.6 since 24-Sep-2018 [5].

Could this be an Ansible version issue, like LP bug 1795411, where support for the Ansible search filter changed?



[1] http://logs.openstack.org/34/600534/16/check/tripleo-ci-centos-7-scenario001-multinode-oooq-container/81a4032/logs/undercloud/home/zuul/overcloud_deploy.log.txt.gz#_2018-10-01_10_03_31

commit_message:
Reinstate openstack-helm checks

A change was merged that had commented out the check jobs. This
simply uncomments them so checks run against changes to
openstack-helm

The change can be found here: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/591808/48

Change-Id: Ia100f1248ebe783d154420c543a9b19fb1ba4ccc

subject: Ensure octavia flavor gets configured if composable octavia
messages: [{'account_id': 6469, 'date': '2018-11-19 18:47:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-11-20 15:55:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2019-01-02 10:16:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-19 18:47:30.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure octavia flavor gets configured if composable octavia

The octavia service templates configure the octavia flavor through the
controller-worker is deployed on a node other than the controller. Since
this uses docker_puppet_tasks, it is only run on the bootstrap node
which at the moment means the first controller. This patch moves the
flavor creation to the docker API template to make sure the flavor gets
created when deploying worker components in an non-standard role.

Conflicts:
    docker/services/octavia-api.yaml

Closes-Bug: #1797443

Change-Id: Id823672b82ea60f355d1f01068f802567d687da5
(cherry picked from commit 7d533b77370311926e23b18ef6dbdbf2c3dcac01)
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure octavia flavor gets configured if composable octavia

The octavia service templates configure the octavia flavor through the
controller-worker is deployed on a node other than the controller. Since
this uses docker_puppet_tasks, it is only run on the bootstrap node
which at the moment means the first controller. This patch moves the
flavor creation to the docker API template to make sure the flavor gets
created when deploying worker components in an non-standard role.

Conflicts:
    docker/services/octavia-api.yaml

Closes-Bug: #1797443

Change-Id: Id823672b82ea60f355d1f01068f802567d687da5
(cherry picked from commit 7d533b77370311926e23b18ef6dbdbf2c3dcac01)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-04 16:05:40.000000000', 'message': "Fix ServiceData in docker/services/aodh-api.yaml

The puppet aodh-api.yaml service uses the puppet
apache service. The apache server uses the cidr
map in ServiceData.

The docker service did not pass the ServiceData
to the puppet service template. The result is
that the properties resolved to ''.

Related-Bug: #1806718
Change-Id: I736e0fa4191fa130f882b09eb87256c62ac69143
(cherry picked from commit 66142908cf85a8e2c1cd502103df6296eea8b1d1)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix ServiceData in docker/services/aodh-api.yaml

The puppet aodh-api.yaml service uses the puppet
apache service. The apache server uses the cidr
map in ServiceData.

The docker service did not pass the ServiceData
to the puppet service template. The result is
that the properties resolved to ''.

Related-Bug: #1806718
Change-Id: I736e0fa4191fa130f882b09eb87256c62ac69143
(cherry picked from commit 66142908cf85a8e2c1cd502103df6296eea8b1d1)

commit_message:
Include octavia::controller

Commits https://review.openstack.org/#/c/612395/ and
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/619013/ deprecated some
parameters in class octavia::worker and moved them to the new class
octavia::controller. The latter commit also removed the include of the
controller class so because of that we have to include it in the Octavia
services manifest files in puppet-tripleo.

Partial-Bug: #1805345

Change-Id: I0256e125de367615c21343683ed5311521d8337c
(cherry picked from commit 43ffaed334e0cdf34329972085ffadd7a2fa1ba0)

commit_message:
Include octavia::controller

Commits https://review.openstack.org/#/c/612395/ and
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/619013/ deprecated some
parameters in class octavia::worker and moved them to the new class
octavia::controller. The latter commit also removed the include of the
controller class so because of that we have to include it in the Octavia
services manifest files in puppet-tripleo.

Partial-Bug: #1805345

Change-Id: I0256e125de367615c21343683ed5311521d8337c

[{'created': '2018-12-06 13:48:13.000000000', 'message': 'neutron-cleanup skips ports marked skip_cleanup=true

The neutron-cleanup script was destroying the entire neutron integration
bridge including ports that are tagged to skip the cleanup process. This
adds logic to skip those ports.

Change-Id: If77933310b5602c5e0d4197584d66d929fc4d8db
Closes-Bug: #1804288

commit_message:
neutron-cleanup skips ports marked skip_cleanup=true

The neutron-cleanup script was destroying the entire neutron integration
bridge including ports that are tagged to skip the cleanup process. This
adds logic to skip those ports.

Change-Id: If77933310b5602c5e0d4197584d66d929fc4d8db
Closes-Bug: #1804288
(cherry picked from commit a9c0fa5ce5a6d42889e29e09ad8edffe0498e39c)

commit_message:
Use template for lower-constraints

Small cleanups:

* Use openstack-lower-constraints-jobs template, remove individual

commit_message:
Update tests for policy-in-code

Neutron has implemented policy-in-code [1], which broke some of our
unit tests that were trying to load defaults from a neutron
policy.json file that no longer exists. Since policy defaults are now
in code, we do not need to load defaults from a file anymore, so this
removes that.

[1] f8984c66996c876d5bbd0cc0c4c47f567e515511

Change-Id: I862e27d9f2284415dcdc57074e2136603d79233d

commit_message:
Add the persist context

Browbeat uses rally to generate results in which the user
can measure the performance results. In the plugin we have
a context called "setup_delay/cleanup_delay" which delays the
start or end of a rally sceneario.

Change-Id: Id228f09039fa0a68556fe42b08ca495f5ae5ba72
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chucks@redhat.com>

subject: Call etcd scaleup playbook when adding master nodes
messages: [{'account_id': 13039, 'date': '2018-12-14 07:17:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2019-01-02 10:15:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-14 07:17:57.000000000', 'message': "Call etcd scaleup playbook when adding master nodes

We're collocating the etcd and master nodes, we should also be run the
etcd scaleup playbook when adding new master nodes to the cluster.
However, this needs to happen in a separate ansible run as the master
node scale up and etcd scale up use different inventory files.

Change-Id: I523ed32681818112b7570aeab3ede32ed4ec322b
Closes-Bug: #1802319
(cherry picked from commit 4702ad329d1ad1624a4b43c3487dc614f833839c)
"}]
commit_message:
Call etcd scaleup playbook when adding master nodes

We're collocating the etcd and master nodes, we should also be run the
etcd scaleup playbook when adding new master nodes to the cluster.
However, this needs to happen in a separate ansible run as the master
node scale up and etcd scale up use different inventory files.

Change-Id: I523ed32681818112b7570aeab3ede32ed4ec322b
Closes-Bug: #1802319
(cherry picked from commit 4702ad329d1ad1624a4b43c3487dc614f833839c)

Openshift-ansible expects that on initial deployment the nodes belong
to a <host_type> group, while on scale up, it expects the new nodes to
belong to a new_<host_type> group and not be part of the <host_type>
one.

Change-Id: Ibe461b4a7948813b69a0f85642e01aebb0531043
(cherry picked from commit cca4eb3aeb41ed79aae9378eceefb8a53ad0c0e6)

commit_message:
Add hosts to expected ansible groups

Openshift-ansible expects that on initial deployment the nodes belong
to a <host_type> group, while on scale up, it expects the new nodes to
belong to a new_<host_type> group and not be part of the <host_type>
one.

Change-Id: Ibe461b4a7948813b69a0f85642e01aebb0531043
(cherry picked from commit cca4eb3aeb41ed79aae9378eceefb8a53ad0c0e6)

commit_message:
Fix validation of job binary with Python3

Currently with Python3 it raises exception
BadJobBinaryInternalException() with Data: b'test-project',
This patch handles it for python3.

Change-Id: I45ce95fdec78af7f21a98613e8c7763bd84ff2aa
Story: 2004688
Task: 28698

subject: Use assertRegex instead of assertRegexpMatches
messages:
[{'account_id': 25903, 'date': '2018-11-06 02:55:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 597, 'date': '2018-11-06 14:22:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

I'm going to +2 this, but something is not right with the gate - jobs gone missing. Let's hold off +A until this is resolved."}, {'account_id': 597, 'date': '2018-11-06 17:33:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I tried this out and I get this (on a test where I replaced assertEqual):

AttributeError: 'TestWSGI' object has no attribute 'assertRegex'

Yes, I know, outside of tox, not valid. But, this is all I have:

python2-unittest2-1.1.0-12.fc28.noarch

And it should work, see:

[zaitcev@lembas swift-tip]$ grep unittest *.txt
lower-constraints.txt:unittest2==1.1.0"}, {'account_id': 597, 'date': '2018-11-06 17:49:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Plot thickens: assertRegex is okay in functional tests but not in unit tests

<timburke> zaitcev: ah... so the s3api func tests inherit from unittest*2*.TestCase (https://github.com/openstack/swift/blob/2.19.0/test/functional/s3api/__init__.py#L30) which not only defines an assertRegex but deprecates assertRegexpMatches (https://hg.python.org/unittest2/file/tip/unittest2/case.py#l1336)'}, {'account_id': 25903, 'date': '2018-11-07 02:09:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hi Pete Zaitcev,
Thanks a lot for your awesome reviews with lots of information.
I really appreciate it!
Wish you a great day ahead :)'}, {'account_id': 17130, 'date': '2018-11-11 13:55:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 597, 'date': '2019-01-02 17:19:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

This needs a rebase. The author (Vu) can update, or I could update when I have the time.'}]

Change-Id: I80b80ae9390827dfb3a1f5401f41aefc1b859a9a

commit_message:
Use assertRegex instead of assertRegexpMatches

In Python3, assertRegexpMatches & assertNotRegexpMatches
are deprecated in favor of assertRegex and assertNotRegex.

Change-Id: I80b80ae9390827dfb3a1f5401f41aefc1b859a9a

Helping the TC stay up to date with the board's work is just as

commit_message:
Update the policy-in-code goal for neutron

Neutron just recently wrapped up their effort to migrate their
policies into code and document them:

  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/585037/

This commit updates the community goal for Queens to accurately
reflect that status.

Change-Id: I748e968cec70470fb9fe8cbe99c3d076e2c9ee2b

- Split off duplicate code across multiple bash scripts into a common
file.

- Simplify the way journals are detacted for block devices.

- Cleanup unused portions of the code.

- Standardize the syntax across all the code.

Change-Id: I13e4a89cab3ee454dd36b5cdedfa2f341bf50b87
"}, {'created': '2018-12-28 18:22:40.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] [CEPH] Cleanup the ceph-osd helm-chart

- Split off duplicate code across multiple bash scripts into a common
file.
- Simplify the way journals are detacted for block devices.
- Cleanup unused portions of the code.
- Standardize the syntax across all the code.
- Zap the OSD disk if the journal disk is missing, otherwise the
pod stays in loopbackfailure.

Change-Id: I13e4a89cab3ee454dd36b5cdedfa2f341bf50b87
'}, {'created': '2018-12-28 18:25:52.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] [CEPH] Cleanup the ceph-osd helm-chart

- Split off duplicate code across multiple bash scripts into a common
file.
- Simplify the way journals are detected for block devices.
- Cleanup unused portions of the code.
- Standardize the syntax across all the code.
- Zap the OSD disk if the journal disk is missing, otherwise the
pod stays in loopbackfailure.

Change-Id: I13e4a89cab3ee454dd36b5cdedfa2f341bf50b87
'}, {'created': '2018-12-28 19:09:31.000000000', 'message': '[CEPH] Cleanup the ceph-osd helm-chart

- Split off duplicate code across multiple bash scripts into a common
file.
- Simplify the way journals are detected for block devices.
- Cleanup unused portions of the code.
- Standardize the syntax across all the code.
- Use sgdisk for zapping disks rather then ceph-disk.

Change-Id: I13e4a89cab3ee454dd36b5cdedfa2f341bf50b87
'}]
commit_message:
[CEPH] Cleanup the ceph-osd helm-chart

- Split off duplicate code across multiple bash scripts into a common
file.
- Simplify the way journals are detected for block devices.
- Cleanup unused portions of the code.
- Standardize the syntax across all the code.
- Use sgdisk for zapping disks rather then ceph-disk.

Change-Id: I13e4a89cab3ee454dd36b5cdedfa2f341bf50b87

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-18 00:58:47.000000000', 'message': '[Calico] Update to v3.4.0

Calico v3.4.0 update.

Notable features upstream:

 * Advertising Kubernetes Service ClusterIPs
   https://docs.projectcalico.org/master/usage/service-advertisement

commit_message:
Don't quote {posargs} in tox.ini

Quotes around {posargs} cause the entire string to be combined into one
arg that gets passed to stestr. This prevents passing multiple args
(e.g. '--concurrency=16 some-regexi

Change-Id: I18b86b7707aa5a4feb1a62d61eea2d522b3882d1
Closes-Bug:#1801829

commit_message:
Add listeners scenarios for Octaiva

Add the following scenarios for Octavia:

- Octavia.create_and_list_listeners
- Octavia.create_and_delete_listeners
- Octavia.create_and_update_listeners
- Octavia.create_and_show_listeners

Depends-On: If3caf123faebeb6ec72bb1472974bf80f3413989
Signed-off-by: Charles Short <chucks@redhat.com>

subject: Add additional tuning options for mariadb/galera
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-14 09:37:52.000000000', 'message': "Add additional tuning options for mariadb/galera

This introduces additional mariadb tuning options, namely:

- innodb_log_file_size:

  Configure the size in bytes of each log file in a log group.
  Generally, the combined size of the log files should be large enough
  that the server can smooth out peaks and troughs in workload activity,
  which often means that there is enough redo log space to handle more
  than an hour of write activity.
  The larger the value, the less checkpoint flush activity is required
  in the buffer pool, saving disk I/O.

- innodb_flush_method

  Defines the method used to flush data to InnoDB data files and log files,
  which can affect I/O throughput. If innodb_flush_method is set to NULL
  on a Unix-like system, the fsync option is used by default.

  The innodb_flush_method options for Unix-like systems include:

  - fsync: InnoDB uses the fsync() system call to flush the data and log files.
  - O_DSYNC: InnoDB uses O_SYNC to open and flush the log files,
    and fsync() to flush the data files.
  - littlesync: currently unsupported. Use at your own risk.
  - nosync: currently unsupported. Use at your own risk.
  - O_DIRECT: InnoDB uses O_DIRECT to open the data files,
    and uses fsync() to flush both the data and log files.

- table_open_cache

  The number of open tables for all threads. Increasing this value
  increases the number of file descriptors that mysqld requires.
  You can check whether you need to increase the table cache by checking the
  Opened_tables status variable. If the value of Opened_tables is large
  and you do not use FLUSH TABLES often, then you should increase the value of
  the table_open_cache variable.

default value for all three is 'undef'.

Change-Id: Idcb1c5b4b7556ed9e26319305f3b6b0d00369ef8
(cherry picked from commit 9289a3e9dea89300eb69c05fa6b0d1baf06eeebe)
"}]
commit_message:
Add additional tuning options for mariadb/galera

This introduces additional mariadb tuning options, namely:

- innodb_log_file_size:

  Configure the size in bytes of each log file in a log group.
  Generally, the combined size of the log files should be large enough
  that the server can smooth out peaks and troughs in workload activity,
  which often means that there is enough redo log space to handle more
  than an hour of write activity.
  The larger the value, the less checkpoint flush activity is required
  in the buffer pool, saving disk I/O.

- innodb_flush_method

  Defines the method used to flush data to InnoDB data files and log files,
  which can affect I/O throughput. If innodb_flush_method is set to NULL
  on a Unix-like system, the fsync option is used by default.

  The innodb_flush_method options for Unix-like systems include:

  - fsync: InnoDB uses the fsync() system call to flush the data and log files.
  - O_DSYNC: InnoDB uses O_SYNC to open and flush the log files,
    and fsync() to flush the data files.
  - littlesync: currently unsupported. Use at your own risk.
  - nosync: currently unsupported. Use at your own risk.
  - O_DIRECT: InnoDB uses O_DIRECT to open the data files,
    and uses fsync() to flush both the data and log files.

- table_open_cache

  The number of open tables for all threads. Increasing this value
  increases the number of file descriptors that mysqld requires.
  You can check whether you need to increase the table cache by checking the
  Opened_tables status variable. If the value of Opened_tables is large
  and you do not use FLUSH TABLES often, then you should increase the value of
  the table_open_cache variable.

default value for all three is 'undef'.

Change-Id: Idcb1c5b4b7556ed9e26319305f3b6b0d00369ef8
(cherry picked from commit 9289a3e9dea89300eb69c05fa6b0d1baf06eeebe)

commit_message:
Ironic Inspector - disjoint ip range(s) for HA

Allow tht parameter IronicInspectorSubnets to specify
per-instance ip range(s) using hostname as key for each
list of ip ranges. For HA deployments use disjoint
address pools to avoid potential address conflict.

Implements: blueprint ironic-inspector-overcloud
Depends-On: Ifae513265b8c35d98012f14f951bac33ae90b66c
Change-Id: Ifdebe9fcc817b4572f1eb461a3396af6b55f1e6b
(cherry picked from commit 2024bb021882695e2d2674f0712813ad8ab38928)

[{'created': '2018-08-09 15:03:14.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: fill port-resource-request

port-resource-request is an admmin-only, read-only attribute for neutron
ports. The content of this field is filled by the QoS minimum bandwidth
rule attached to the port.

commit_message:
Fill port-resource-request

port-resource-request is an admin-only, read-only attribute for neutron
ports. The content of this field is filled from the QoS minimum
bandwidth rule attached to the port.

Change-Id: Ic9862a1b5e24eb798d67823ac3bacab9e54420d8
Partial-Bug: #1578989
See-Also: https://review.openstack.org/502306 (nova spec)
See-Also: https://review.openstack.org/508149 (neutron spec)

commit_message:
Update tuned profile variable configuration file if it exists

Update /etc/tuned/{{ _TUNED_PROFILE_NAME_ }}-variables.conf only
if it exists.

Change-Id: I20562efd61ba49b3ae0af62c079967681e05aeed
Closes-Bug: #1806812
(cherry picked from commit ce72766b97edd746466f997f5b53eff933164aed)

commit_message:
Utilize bulk port creation ops in ml2 plugin

Rather than iterating through all ports and leveraging the heavyweight
ml2 method, try leveraging the optimized bulk methods.

Change-Id: I6740f81ed9b8f30f9782e9426009f8ee70ec023d
Implements: blueprint speed-up-neutron-bulk-creation

[{'created': '2018-12-18 07:30:49.000000000', 'message': 'Perform docker reconfiguration on upgrade_tasks.

The container-registry role is idempotent in a way that the
restarting of the docker service will be done only if some
configuration value has changed.
During the upgrade, host_prep_tasks are being run and if the
new templates bring some configuration change then the Docker
service gets restarted. The issue is the point at which they
get restarted, which is after the upgrade_tasks have already
run and prior to the deploy_tasks. This is causing issues with
Pacemaker handled resources.

For that reason, we include the very same task running in host_prep_tasks
into upgrade_tasks for the docker and docker-registry services,
forcing the Docker service reconfiguration to happen during

commit_message:
Perform docker reconfiguration on upgrade_tasks.

The container-registry role is idempotent in a way that the
restarting of the docker service will be done only if some
configuration value has changed.
During the upgrade, host_prep_tasks are being run and if the
new templates bring some configuration change then the Docker
service gets restarted. The issue is the point at which they
get restarted, which is after the upgrade_tasks have already
run and prior to the deploy_tasks. This is causing issues with
Pacemaker handled resources.

For that reason, we include the very same task running in host_prep_tasks
into upgrade_tasks for the docker and docker-registry services,
forcing the Docker service reconfiguration to happen during
upgrade_tasks instead of at a latter point.

This patch also fixes the typo included in the master branch patch
I5e6ca987c01ff72a3c7e8900f9572024521164de that caused LP#1808974.

Closes-Bug: #1807418
Related-Bug: #1808974
Change-Id: I5e6ca987c01ff72a3c7e8900f9572024521164de
(cherry picked from commit 5bc5ae944a32d5c24090a4c5f5e44c64c2879c1a)

commit_message:
Improve the openshift-nw-openstack validation

This validation should be executed only if an overcloud has been deployed and
working. This patch tests if an overcloud is present and if it's not the case
the validation will succeed with a warning.

Change-Id: I366238859c27d07df4b50a9c0b94400a4731817f
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit fdf261254eb1dc74c3f2f6a528a175da30d3ee95)

[{'created': '2018-12-23 10:38:44.000000000', 'message': "Fix ceilometerdb-size validation

Ceilometer doesn't deal with metrics database anymore and Gnocchi doesn't have
interesting parameters to check according to this validation. We can only check
the 'event_ttl_check' in the panko configuration file which crontols the number
of seconds that an event is kept in the database. We also have to note that
panko won't exist anymore in the Stein release.

This patch simplifies this validation.

Change-Id: I2c655cacb748596068d5cfb7cb89eb33ac5cdbbe
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 48cdf07abed368205f285493e61f81604f25096d)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix ceilometerdb-size validation

Ceilometer doesn't deal with metrics database anymore and Gnocchi doesn't have
interesting parameters to check according to this validation. We can only check
the 'event_ttl_check' in the panko configuration file which crontols the number
of seconds that an event is kept in the database. We also have to note that
panko won't exist anymore in the Stein release.

This patch simplifies this validation.

Change-Id: I2c655cacb748596068d5cfb7cb89eb33ac5cdbbe
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 48cdf07abed368205f285493e61f81604f25096d)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-23 10:43:32.000000000', 'message': "Fix ctlplane-ip-range validations

The `undercloud.conf` file has now 2 sections (DEFAULT and ctlplane-subnet).
A small numbers of parameters have been deprecated and moved to the
ctlplane-subnet section. Morever, the `undercloud_conf` custom plugin has some
issues to generate facts coming from the 'undercloud.conf' file due to the new
section.

This patch proposes to use the 'ini' custom plugin to get parameter's values
from the undercloud.conf file instead of using the 'undercloud_conf' custom
plugin.

Resolves: rhbz#1660075

Change-Id: I7689e1c8f7f44058b0ad44318c5eef522ddfad52
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 5417bbdf43952d99667ffe41349174a4fc4072fe)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix ctlplane-ip-range validations

The `undercloud.conf` file has now 2 sections (DEFAULT and ctlplane-subnet).
A small numbers of parameters have been deprecated and moved to the
ctlplane-subnet section. Morever, the `undercloud_conf` custom plugin has some
issues to generate facts coming from the 'undercloud.conf' file due to the new
section.

This patch proposes to use the 'ini' custom plugin to get parameter's values
from the undercloud.conf file instead of using the 'undercloud_conf' custom
plugin.

Resolves: rhbz#1660075

Change-Id: I7689e1c8f7f44058b0ad44318c5eef522ddfad52
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 5417bbdf43952d99667ffe41349174a4fc4072fe)

commit_message:
Fix regression in neutron-fwaas-dashboard mapping

The change https://review.openstack.org/#/c/622228/ broke
the mapping for neutron-fwaas dashboard. The change introduced
there did not match "neutron-fwaas" because of only matching
for a single word, not a word combination connected by "-".

Change-Id: I9b427b21dfede77935bcfb9559a9afde8957428e

commit_message:
[DevRef] Add code review guideline

Clarify the manila code review guidelines
in the developer docs. This document evolved
as part of the discussions at the Denver PTG [1]
and the manila community meeting on 4th Oct 2018 [2].

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/manila-ptg-planning-denver-2018
[2] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/manila/2018/manila.2018-10-04-15.01.log.txt

Change-Id: I953ac9c1ef641db13a4f0165a7b74e447641a7f4

commit_message:
Use template for lower-constraints

Small cleanups:

* Use openstack-lower-constraints-jobs template, remove individual
  jobs.
* Sort list of templates

Change-Id: I08349e13587b16f91f0433c6f559bd7089517784
Needed-By: https://review.openstack.org/623229

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-07 22:24:52.000000000', 'message': 'Replace tripleo_common/utils/roles.py validate_role_yaml()

In change: I773a38fd903fe287132151a4d178326a46890969 the
validate_role_yaml() method was updated to allow networks
in roles_data.yaml to be either a list or a dict.

Change: I77edc82723d00bfece6752b5dd2c79137db93443 depends
on this to allow tox-pep8 tests to pass when it changes
roles_data to be a dict.

Due to how tox uses requirements the openstack-tox-pep8
job does not use the yet to be released tripleo_common.
This result in CI test failures on the latter change
until we have a new release of tripleo_common and
bump constraints.

This change replaces the validate_role_yaml() method
in tools/roles-data-generate.py to allow tests to pass.

NOTE: This change should be reverted once we have a
new tripleo_common release and bumped constraints.

Change-Id: I38c4fd40101345bdaeab2cba45869ed30b8de0ef

commit_message:
Replace tripleo_common/utils/roles.py validate_role_yaml()

In change: I773a38fd903fe287132151a4d178326a46890969 the
validate_role_yaml() method was updated to allow networks
in roles_data.yaml to be either a list or a dict.

Change: I77edc82723d00bfece6752b5dd2c79137db93443 depends
on this to allow tox-pep8 tests to pass when it changes
roles_data to be a dict.

Due to how tox uses requirements the openstack-tox-pep8
job does not use the yet to be released tripleo_common.
This result in CI test failures on the latter change
until we have a new release of tripleo_common and
bump constraints.

This change replaces the validate_role_yaml() method
in tools/roles-data-generate.py to allow tests to pass.

NOTE: This change should be reverted once we have a
new tripleo_common release and bumped constraints.

Change-Id: I38c4fd40101345bdaeab2cba45869ed30b8de0ef

commit_message:
Fix image_name retrieval in custom-image jobs

And use a 'file://' url for the custom manila image.

See also https://review.openstack.org/#/c/623330.  These
are interdependent patches but no harm is done by merging
this one first and having 623330 depend on it since retrieval
of the image name is not working correctly anyways.

Partial-Bug: #1807969

Change-Id: Ib3a74d170f159dfbc38b5302f00800f3530f4921
(cherry picked from commit 6299ed5ed001ae2768ed2b954730b526b4053b2c)
(cherry picked from commit 758eaac8cc273c6e035cece339a4215d2ce8c6e9)

commit_message:
DNM Adding Bionic jobs to experimental queue

This patch adds most of single node jobs from check queue to be run
on Ubuntu Bionic in experimental queue for now.
Lets see what we will have to fix for Bionic.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/610977/

Change-Id: Iddb299022e9100ad78dd42ea6102ca55d07932e0

[{'created': '2018-11-26 16:21:51.000000000', 'message': "Don't fail when node is in CLEANFAIL state

When a timeout occurs when a node is in CLEANWAIT state, the conductor
puts it into the CLEANFAIL state. However, it tries to do that twice, and
our state machine doesn't support moving from a CLEANFAIL state to another
state via the 'fail' verb/event.

The code was changed so that it doesn't try to move it to CLEANFAIL twice,
and a check is put to prevent the node from being 'failed' frome a CLEANFAIL
state.

Change-Id: Ieeb77dd28a5d3053588c46fe2a700b5e6ceabbd7

commit_message:
Don't fail when node is in CLEANFAIL state

When a timeout occurs when a node is in CLEANWAIT state, the conductor
puts it into the CLEANFAIL state. However, it tries to do that twice, and
our state machine doesn't support moving from a CLEANFAIL state to another
state via the 'fail' verb/event.

The code was changed so that it doesn't try to move it to CLEANFAIL twice,
and a check is put to prevent the node from being 'failed' frome a CLEANFAIL
state.

Change-Id: Ieeb77dd28a5d3053588c46fe2a700b5e6ceabbd7
Story: 2004299
Task: 27855
(cherry picked from commit 78ae60f11ee708442249c3b00f06d5e0fe73910d)

Replace scenario001-multinode with scenario001-standalone

The scenario001-standalone job is added in the depends-on below.
Tracked by tripleo ci squad at [1]
[1] https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/us/191

neutron_conf:

* The list of service_plugins changed. The old one is "service_plugins = neutron.services.l3_router.l3_router_plugin.L3RouterPlugin,neutron.services.metering.metering_plugin.MeteringPlugin,qos,trunk,log,segments", the new one is "service_plugins = neutron.services.l3_router.l3_router_plugin.L3RouterPlugin,neutron.services.metering.metering_plugin.MeteringPlugin"
* The config 'dns_domain' was set in the old job but not set in the new job

ml2_conf.ini.gz:

* The config 'extension_drivers' is changed. The old one is "extension_drivers = port_security,qos,dns_domain_ports" and the new one is "extension_drivers = port_security"
* Agent's extensions was set in the old job but not set in the new job
* Several other configs are changed as well.'}, {'account_id': 27654, 'date': '2018-09-26 22:50:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

I believe the difference is mostly due to the object store tests being excluded as a result of "s-object: false" in the definition of tempest-full-py3 [3].  In order to get things to line up properly I am basing it off of tempest-full now (as you originally suggested @Slawek) and we can switch to tempest-full-py3 in the fullness of time as a separate change.

commit_message:
Convert neutron-tempest-iptables_hybrid job to zuulv3 format

Convert the neutron-tempest-iptables_hybrid job to the new and updated
Zuul v3 syntax.  This obviates the need for the ansible playbooks.  It
is also updated to use py36, which requires it run on the ubuntu-bionic
nodeset.

This is needed in order to create a version of this job that functions
on Fedora 28.  The legacy job used devstack-gate which does not
understand 'dnf'.

Change-Id: I041dc6e623b61748f2285c4aecead28af12ee15b

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6928, 'name': 'Ben Nemec', 'email': 'openstack@nemebean.com', 'username': 'bnemec'}, {'_account_id': 8731, 'name': 'Renat Akhmerov', 'email': 'renat.akhmerov@gmail.com', 'username': 'rakhmerov'}, {'_account_id': 9712, 'name': 'Dougal Matthews', 'email': 'dougal.matthews@canonical.com', 'username': 'dougal'}, {'_account_id': 9796, 'name': 'ChangBo Guo', 'email': 'glongwave@gmail.com', 'username': 'gcb'}, {'_account_id': 15334, 'name': 'Stephen Finucane', 'display_name': 'stephenfin', 'email': 'stephenfin@redhat.com', 'username': 'sfinucan'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 28522, 'name': 'Herv Beraud', 'email': 'herveberaud.pro@gmail.com', 'username': 'hberaud'}]
