[{'account_id': 9712, 'date': '2018-12-20 09:45:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2018-12-20 10:08:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2018-12-20 15:33:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2018-12-20 15:33:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 9712, 'date': '2018-12-21 09:59:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 9712, 'date': '2018-12-21 10:01:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2018-12-21 13:25:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-12-21 15:14:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

There was an issue with the latest versions of dogpile and the sdk: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2018-December/000933.html

This should be fine to work around the brokenness of pip dependency calculations. Although I'm surprised this is a problem given that upper-constraints limits it to 0.6.8: http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/requirements/tree/upper-constraints.txt#n398 Are you not using upper-constraints in your jobs?"}, {'account_id': 9712, 'date': '2018-12-21 16:13:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> There was an issue with the latest versions of dogpile and the sdk:
 > http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2018-December/000933.html
 > 
 > This should be fine to work around the brokenness of pip dependency
 > calculations. Although I'm surprised this is a problem given that
 > upper-constraints limits it to 0.6.8: http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/requirements/tree/upper-constraints.txt#n398
 > Are you not using upper-constraints in your jobs?

We are, I think, here: https://github.com/openstack/mistral/blob/master/tox.ini#L14

but maybe it isn't working correctly? I'll try and investigate more."}, {'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2018-12-24 01:54:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 9796, 'date': '2019-01-02 11:35:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Update the requirements to match global-requirements for dogpile.cache

For some reason this is resulting in a version conflict with
openstacksdk in some situations. Updating to match global-requirements
should resolve it.

Change-Id: I3a9af8b738da8ebf0c1f4cf632984bc4a0875d90
Related-Bug: #1809232

commit_message:
Exclude build request marker from server listing

When listing "real" (already in cell) instances e.g. from
nova_cell1.instances table, a marker option means "start after the
instance with marker".

For VMs:

| uuid | name |
| 1    | vm1  |
| 2    | vm2  |

"openstack server list --marker 1" returns vm2 only.

But for VMs from nova_api.build_requests table it's different.

For VMs:

| uuid | name |
| 1    | vm1  |
| 2    | vm2  |

"openstack server list --marker 1" returns both vm1 and vm2.

This patch excludes instance with marker from listing for
instances from build_requests table.

Closes-Bug: #1808286
Change-Id: I5165b69f956fbf1904112a742698b2739f747e72
(cherry picked from commit 2ef704cba619a149336692311c2614742aa32909)

subject: Ignore undefined values in customizable filter
messages: [{'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-12-27 09:12:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 23717, 'date': '2018-12-28 06:26:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 19316, 'date': '2019-01-02 09:45:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-27 09:12:11.000000000', 'message': 'Ignore undefined values in customizable filter

When using the customizable filter to modify variables, if a template
overrides file is shared between multiple sets of images, it is sometimes
possible that a customised variable does not exist for a set of images.
A specific example:

My template overrides file has this:

{% set ironic_inspector_packages_append = ["python-pip"] %}

Normally I build binary/centos images.

kolla-build -t binary

Sometimes however I build a bifrost centos/source image, because bifrost
does not support binary images.

kolla-build -t source bifrost

The ironic inspector image does not define ironic_inspector_packages for
the source build, since it does not need any.

{% elif install_type == 'source' %}
    {% if base_distro in ['debian', 'ubuntu'] %}
        {% set ironic_inspector_packages = ['iptables'] %}
    {% endif %}

{{ macros.install_packages(ironic_inspector_packages |
        customizable("packages")) }}

The install_packages macro copes with the undefined variable, however
the customizable filter does not handle the base variable being
undefined if a customised example exists.

This change allows the customizable filter to ignore undefined
variables, even if they have been customised.

Change-Id: Ibe2fc91f5b6ceee8f937dd73c235128b2db525b1
Closes-Bug: #1809491
(cherry picked from commit f8d86969d0c042fd29d29df41ddd4052f687af55)
'}]
commit_message:
Ignore undefined values in customizable filter

When using the customizable filter to modify variables, if a template
overrides file is shared between multiple sets of images, it is sometimes
possible that a customised variable does not exist for a set of images.
A specific example:

My template overrides file has this:

{% set ironic_inspector_packages_append = ["python-pip"] %}

Normally I build binary/centos images.

kolla-build -t binary

Sometimes however I build a bifrost centos/source image, because bifrost
does not support binary images.

kolla-build -t source bifrost

The ironic inspector image does not define ironic_inspector_packages for
the source build, since it does not need any.

{% elif install_type == 'source' %}
    {% if base_distro in ['debian', 'ubuntu'] %}
        {% set ironic_inspector_packages = ['iptables'] %}
    {% endif %}

{{ macros.install_packages(ironic_inspector_packages |
        customizable("packages")) }}

The install_packages macro copes with the undefined variable, however
the customizable filter does not handle the base variable being
undefined if a customised example exists.

This change allows the customizable filter to ignore undefined
variables, even if they have been customised.

Change-Id: Ibe2fc91f5b6ceee8f937dd73c235128b2db525b1
Closes-Bug: #1809491
(cherry picked from commit f8d86969d0c042fd29d29df41ddd4052f687af55)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-21 22:08:55.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure rbd auth fallback uses matching credentials

As of Ocata, cinder config is preferred for rbd auth values with a
fallback to nova values [1]. The fallback path, for the case when
rbd_user is configured in cinder.conf and rbd_secret_uuid is not
configured in cinder.conf, results in the mismatched use of cinder
rbd_user with nova rbd_secret_uuid.

This fixes that fallback path to use nova rbd_user from nova.conf
with rbd_secret_uuid from nova.conf.

[1] See commit f2d27f6a8afb62815fb6a885bd4f8ae4ed287fd3

Thanks to David Ames for this fix.

Change-Id: Ieba216275c07ab16414065ee47e66915e9e9477d
Co-Authored-By: David Ames <david.ames@canonical.com>
Closes-Bug: #1809454
'}, {'created': '2018-12-26 00:06:30.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure rbd auth fallback uses matching credentials

As of Ocata, cinder config is preferred for rbd auth values with a
fallback to nova values [1]. The fallback path, for the case when
rbd_user is configured in cinder.conf and rbd_secret_uuid is not
configured in cinder.conf, results in the mismatched use of cinder
rbd_user with nova rbd_secret_uuid.

This fixes that fallback path to use nova rbd_user from nova.conf
with rbd_secret_uuid from nova.conf.

[1] See commit f2d27f6a8afb62815fb6a885bd4f8ae4ed287fd3

Thanks to David Ames for this fix.

Change-Id: Ieba216275c07ab16414065ee47e66915e9e9477d
Co-Authored-By: David Ames <david.ames@canonical.com>
Closes-Bug: #1809454
(cherry picked from commit 47b7c4f3cc582bf463fd0c796df84736a0074f48)

commit_message:
Ensure rbd auth fallback uses matching credentials

As of Ocata, cinder config is preferred for rbd auth values with a
fallback to nova values [1]. The fallback path, for the case when
rbd_user is configured in cinder.conf and rbd_secret_uuid is not
configured in cinder.conf, results in the mismatched use of cinder
rbd_user with nova rbd_secret_uuid.

This fixes that fallback path to use nova rbd_user from nova.conf
with rbd_secret_uuid from nova.conf.

[1] See commit f2d27f6a8afb62815fb6a885bd4f8ae4ed287fd3

Thanks to David Ames for this fix.

Change-Id: Ieba216275c07ab16414065ee47e66915e9e9477d
Co-Authored-By: David Ames <david.ames@canonical.com>
Closes-Bug: #1809454
(cherry picked from commit 47b7c4f3cc582bf463fd0c796df84736a0074f48)

commit_message:
Fixing wrong value in override_config in test of getting volume filter

In ut test: test_get_volume_filter_options_using_config, there is using
'self.override_config('resource_query_filters_file', {'volume': filter_list})'
to reset the config value, but it's not right since resource_query_filter_file
should be a string of file path.

Now, this causes the IOError 'No such file or directory' when running it in
local enviroment.

Change-Id: I79110689e9786b92e0a5571173e38011ce964b8f
Closes-Bug: #1809707

This patch adds the option to split retrieved volumes and snapshots
by chunks during Volume Manager host initialization. Query results
will be obtained in batches from the database and not in one shot
to avoid extreme memory usage. Max number of volumes and snapshots
per batch is controlled by option init_host_max_objects_retrieval.

To migrate any ConfKeyManager keys based on fixed_key to the currently

Change-Id: I5aca5f81786fe18e2668dde6b026496535f758d4
Closes-Bug: 1681374
'}]
commit_message:
Initiating Cinder Volume Manager with large number of volumes

This patch adds the option to split retrieved volumes and snapshots
by chunks during Volume Manager host initialization. Query results
will be obtained in batches from the database and not in one shot
to avoid extreme memory usage. Max number of volumes and snapshots
per batch is controlled by option init_host_max_objects_retrieval.
Option is disabled by default for backward compatibility.

To migrate any ConfKeyManager keys based on fixed_key to the currently
configured key manager Volume Manager will use special lightweight
object - VolumeMigration.

Change-Id: I5aca5f81786fe18e2668dde6b026496535f758d4
Closes-Bug: 1681374

[{'created': '2018-12-11 10:36:44.000000000', 'message': '[Configuration] Fix tox python3 overrides.

We want to default running all tox environments under python 3, so set
the basepython value in each environment. We do not want to specify a
minor number, because we do not want to have to update the file every
time we upgrade python. We do not want to set the override once in
testenv, because that breaks the more specific versions used in default.

Change-Id: I619708463e67bcdc3527222b1a7ecde32070694a
'}]
commit_message:
[Configuration] Fix tox python3 overrides.

We want to default running all tox environments under python 3, so set
the basepython value in each environment. We do not want to specify a
minor number, because we do not want to have to update the file every
time we upgrade python. We do not want to set the override once in
testenv, because that breaks the more specific versions used in default.

Change-Id: I619708463e67bcdc3527222b1a7ecde32070694a

commit_message:
Add Storage network to IronicConductor role

access to swift. To access swift it needs the storage
network.

[{'created': '2018-12-20 13:40:44.000000000', 'message': "Document using service user tokens for long running operations

A recent thread in the mailing list [1] reminded me that we
don't have any documentation for the service user token feature
added back in ocata under blueprint use-service-tokens.

This change adds a troubleshooting entry for when using service
user tokens would be useful, and links to it from two known
trouble spots: live migration timeouts and creating images.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2018-December/001130.html

Change-Id: I1dda889038ffe67d53ceb35049aa1f2a9da39ae8

"}]
commit_message:
Document using service user tokens for long running operations

A recent thread in the mailing list [1] reminded me that we
don't have any documentation for the service user token feature
added back in ocata under blueprint use-service-tokens.

This change adds a troubleshooting entry for when using service
user tokens would be useful, and links to it from two known
trouble spots: live migration timeouts and creating images.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2018-December/001130.html

Change-Id: I1dda889038ffe67d53ceb35049aa1f2a9da39ae8
Closes-Bug: #1809165
(cherry picked from commit 1a4cc6c96dc9acd5e6bc467f85cb77dd9e32c8d4)

In I68e064d23ec5d43f59146d974cae604d2c5fdb52 we start

on the ControlVirtualIP resource.

commit_message:
Extend DeployedServerPortMap to include network props

In I68e064d23ec5d43f59146d974cae604d2c5fdb52 we start
using the 'tags' of the ctlplane network via get_attr
on the ControlVirtualIP resource.

Deployed Server users will have to extend the port map
(DeployedServerPortMap) to include the network and tags.

Change-Id: I458f188998305785bdfe3681d29a055432c67b5f

subject: Use python_requires to match ansible requirements
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-22 19:37:32.000000000', 'message': 'Use python_requires to match ansible requirements

Avoid the case where tripleo-quickstarts attempts to install ansible
on platforms where ansible is no longer supported.

Using basepython=python3 would make tox use python3.4 on CentOS 7
because this is what "python3" commands points to. On the other hand
on Fedora 28+ this points to python3.6 which is supported by Ansible.

Developers will still be able to use py3 on CentOS if they install
a newer version than the outdated py34.

Change-Id: Idc788dbe7468584e43c77febe49448d68959fcf3
'}]
commit_message:
Use python_requires to match ansible requirements

Avoid the case where tripleo-quickstarts attempts to install ansible
on platforms where ansible is no longer supported.

Using basepython=python3 would make tox use python3.4 on CentOS 7
because this is what "python3" commands points to. On the other hand
on Fedora 28+ this points to python3.6 which is supported by Ansible.

Developers will still be able to use py3 on CentOS if they install
a newer version than the outdated py34.

Change-Id: Idc788dbe7468584e43c77febe49448d68959fcf3

subject: Update the baremetal overcloud documentation with Stein changes
messages: [{'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-11-28 16:59:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2018-12-05 13:16:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2019-01-02 10:49:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-28 16:59:11.000000000', 'message': "Update the baremetal overcloud documentation with Stein changes

* Host aggregates should no longer be used for separating bare metal and virtual
  flavors since in Stein a flavor can only target either of these anyway.
* Prefer to use resource classes for separating bare metal and virtual flavors
  even before Stein and up to Pike.
* We ended up not supporting networking-generic-switch, mention networking-ansible
  instead. A more detailed documentation is being written on this topic.
* Remove anything about Newton since it's EOL.

Change-Id: I8026f5d9cad5237810e937d3b575f8f2fb2dd19d
"}]
commit_message:
Update the baremetal overcloud documentation with Stein changes

* Host aggregates should no longer be used for separating bare metal and virtual
  flavors since in Stein a flavor can only target either of these anyway.
* Prefer to use resource classes for separating bare metal and virtual flavors
  even before Stein and up to Pike.
* We ended up not supporting networking-generic-switch, mention networking-ansible
  instead. A more detailed documentation is being written on this topic.
* Remove anything about Newton since it's EOL.

Change-Id: I8026f5d9cad5237810e937d3b575f8f2fb2dd19d

Change location of novajoin-ipa-setup to bin dir

The location of this script is changed in the upstream project due to
the way setuptools supports Python 3 compatibility in scripts.

See https://review.openstack.org/620109 .

commit_message:
Temporarily mark multinode job non-voting

The multinode job is failing again in stable branches pike
and queens. In queens the job is already non-voting, marking
it non-voting in pike as well until we are able to discover
the root cause and have a fix.
This will allow contributors to keep working on the pike branch
until we resolve the job issues.

Change-Id: I2f72b042996e3667315f5b79c132e1cb404b2639

commit_message:
Workaround for functional DBNonExistentTable failures

This patch contains a workaround which handles the DBNonExistentTable
exceptions that are coming from the functional tests cleanUp() method
sometimes.

This patch is only a workaround to alleviate the gate and should not be
considered a proper fix. A FIXME comment was left in the code and the
bug must remains open so a proper investigation of the problem can be
done later.

Partial-Bug: #1808146
Change-Id: Icf965e9df9def597268683b8ca57db1aec17d313
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

[{'created': '2018-10-30 15:33:46.000000000', 'message': 'Remove setup.py check from tox template

Using "python setup.py check -r -s" method of checking the package has
been deprecated with the new recommendation to build the sdist and
wheel, then running "twine check" against the output.

Luckily, there is already a job that covers this that only runs when the
README, setup.py, or setup.cfg files change, making running this in the
pep8 job redundant. This covered by the test-release-openstack-python3
that is defined in the publish-to-pypi-python3 template.

More details can be found in this mailing list post:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/136136.html

Change-Id: I544d9940e8c89d50346c71e3df2fe1166850f7ef
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Remove setup.py check from tox template

Using "python setup.py check -r -s" method of checking the package has
been deprecated with the new recommendation to build the sdist and
wheel, then running "twine check" against the output.

Luckily, there is already a job that covers this that only runs when the
README, setup.py, or setup.cfg files change, making running this in the
pep8 job redundant. This covered by the test-release-openstack-python3
that is defined in the publish-to-pypi-python3 template.

More details can be found in this mailing list post:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/136136.html

Change-Id: I544d9940e8c89d50346c71e3df2fe1166850f7ef
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

[{'created': '2018-12-12 18:29:11.000000000', 'message': "Adds ability to set no-resolv for dnsmasq.

Introduces variable neutron_dnsmasq_noresolv. When it is set to true,
no-resolv option will be placed in dnsmasq-neutron.conf.

If dnsmasq_dns_servers are not set, and neutron_dnsmasq_noresolv is True
dnsmasq will reply with empty response on DNS requests,
which may be used as a workaround of
https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1501206
As a con, resolver is actually won't work at all, so all networks w/o
configured DNS will stop resolving DNS.

Change-Id: I7764e0d6100a8327f84f78da64f10f8e1fa355b1

commit_message:
Adds ability to set no-resolv for dnsmasq.

Introduces variable neutron_dnsmasq_noresolv. When it is set to true,
no-resolv option will be placed in dnsmasq-neutron.conf.

If dnsmasq_dns_servers are not set, and neutron_dnsmasq_noresolv is True
dnsmasq will reply with empty response on DNS requests,
which may be used as a workaround of
https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1501206
As a con, resolver is actually won't work at all, so all networks w/o
configured DNS will stop resolving DNS.

Change-Id: I7764e0d6100a8327f84f78da64f10f8e1fa355b1
(cherry picked from commit 1d2d3d086dbbdc8d7387b6f71c0780d6df85ecb9)

Backup will never be error_restoring...'}, {'account_id': 20722, 'date': '2018-11-23 01:54:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> > (1 comment)
 > >
 > > +1 on removing, but it would be good to step forward one step
 > 
 > Backup will never be error_restoring...

It's right to remove error_restoring in here, but I mean that we better to refresh all backup status in this doc:

    ERROR = 'error'
    ERROR_DELETING = 'error_deleting'
    CREATING = 'creating'
    AVAILABLE = 'available'
    DELETING = 'deleting'
    DELETED = 'deleted'
    RESTORING = 'restoring'"}, {'account_id': 27615, 'date': '2018-11-23 05:03:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Agree with Yikun, since we're updating the backup status table, its better to have all valid states."}, {'account_id': 25837, 'date': '2019-01-02 09:26:52.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-09 07:06:14.000000000', 'message': "Delete backup's error_restoring status in API doc

The status error_restoring is a state of the volume, not backup,
just delete it from the doc.

Change-Id: Ib1cde77254f2ae31e9d65fe7d69350b50c501b68
"}]
commit_message:
Delete backup's error_restoring status in API doc

The status error_restoring is a state of the volume, not backup,
just delete it from the doc.

Change-Id: Ib1cde77254f2ae31e9d65fe7d69350b50c501b68

commit_message:
Allow different conf source path

Setting the CONF_SRC_DIR environment will take the template
dragonflow.ini from that path during install.

Change-Id: I57bf5aeb832e9fc68101e322691cc54cb9e20286

in this patch we will implement new action for L7Policy.

commit_message:
Support REDIRECT_PREFIX action for L7Policy

Currently, Octavia only support three actions for L7Policy,
in this patch we will implement new action for L7Policy.

Story: 2003700

Change-Id: Ie99591ede097b566294ebdb673c460442dd6d942
(cherry picked from commit 62192dba3ac97e90b9840e09f2e0c93c92ac5a62)

messages:
[{'account_id': 22936, 'date': '2018-12-18 08:48:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-12-18 08:48:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-31 16:49:24.000000000', 'message': "Skip healing container on missing container_id

Container healing is based on the assuption that the container
was created in docker thus containing the 'container_id'.
However, this assuption is not always valid.
This commit skips the healing if there is no container_id.

Change-Id: I1723169e060773f8a7e58c760c847062f8e04493
"}]
commit_message:
Skip healing container on missing container_id

Container healing is based on the assuption that the container
was created in docker thus containing the 'container_id'.
However, this assuption is not always valid.
This commit skips the healing if there is no container_id.

Change-Id: I1723169e060773f8a7e58c760c847062f8e04493

commit_message:
Add cache configuration for ceilometer project

when using ceilometer+gnocchi, for every notification sample, ceilometer
will update the resource even if is not updated.

We should add [cache] section to make ceilometer cache the resource, and
stop send the useless update request.

Closes-Bug: #1807841
Change-Id: Ic33b4cd5ba8165c20878cab068f38a3948c9d31d

commit_message:
Make scenario004-standalone job voting

the scenario004-multinode on master. This makes it voting. Tracked
by ci squad with [2].

commit_message:
Remove support for py34

Due to the change from Ubuntu Trusty to Xenial, only python3.5 is
available(Python3.4 is restricted to <= Mitaka). So, there is no
need to continue to keep these settings.

Change-Id: I01cfffa2a18a287420a59b9b218e08e848253b27

commit_message:
Speed-Up CI - openstack-client-as-a-service on the undercloud

Adds a socket base client/server wrapper around the openstack
cli command. By doing this we reduce the time to run openstack
commands by close to 2 seconds per command invocation.

Change-Id: If65ae4cab10afa8465149de270af2c25b8758949

[2] http://paste.openstack.org/show/738265/

commit_message:
Check if instance_id is not None

get_label returns instance_id that can be None [1].
It could lead to the exception [2]. The patch will
resolve it.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/vitrage/blob/master/vitrage/datasources/prometheus/properties.py#L56
[2] http://paste.openstack.org/show/738265/

Change-Id: Ic914832fde53cd904bfc0e3313348d3025c69ca0
(cherry picked from commit d7d4188d061bd0889c8fdb347844ced89ee402ac)

commit_message:
support dot format

you can view the graph in dot format instead of json
using the "-f dot" in cli command for topology and rca

dot format is very common for visualization of graphs
there are many tools that support this format including
online visualizers

Story: 2004063
Task: 27070

Change-Id: I44779d5d46a6ca279e2766b0d3f8e7ca02706b84

LGTM'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-12-04 20:40:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

I'm a bit worried about how these different types of tests are being mixed together.

cinder/tests/unit/api/v3/test_volume_protection.py are the unit tests for the API extension; they should only be concerned with whether it works or not, not with the values of the default policies.  (That's why the original didn't have different tests for admin or regular users.)  You could refactor it like this:

http://paste.openstack.org/show/736667/

What that paste does is explicitly set the policy within each test and then verifies that the attribute is in/not in the response.  (I think it's a bad idea to couple these unit tests with the default policy settings.)

cinder/tests/unit/api/v3/test_volume_protection.py is the test you're adding to make sure that the default policy settings don't regress.  I'm not sure that it's a good idea to mix these checks for whether an extension's policy default setting is correct in the middle of tests that are verifying that a different policy has the expected value.  I know it seems kind of redundant, but I think they should be in their own tests."}, {'account_id': 20722, 'date': '2018-12-05 07:24:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> You could refactor it like this:
 > http://paste.openstack.org/show/736667/

done

 > 
 > I know it seems kind of redundant, but I think they should be in their own tests.
 > 

done

@brian Thanks for all your idea!'}, {'account_id': 20722, 'date': '2018-12-05 08:04:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 20284, 'date': '2018-12-05 08:20:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

commit_message:
Add policy test for TENANT_ATTRIBUTE_POLICY

Add policy test for TENANT_ATTRIBUTE_POLICY, and remove it from
test policy file, the default of TENANT_ATTRIBUTE_POLICY is
'RULE_ADMIN_OR_OWNER', that means only admin and owner are authorized
to show 'tenant_id'.

This is one of the serious patches of policy-in-code test, see
more information on [1] and [2].

[1] 530fb9319ce21b7ff99e55f095c04f13f0785842
[2] f207bac80924ffaf6d4c2a500c295d0e2e71966e

Change-Id: Ibc674d05eb391e2bc83bfc83bfdce99e5e692ab5

commit_message:
remove glusterfs-nfs job from check queue

The job never passes, is unmaintained, and
wastes CI resources.

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-05 18:02:55.000000000', 'message': "SF ensure the correct volume is deleted

When two management systems are available openstack/cinder and
SolidFire-API/GUI  a volume can be deleted though either interface. Thus
if a volume is deleted through the SolidFire-interface and then again
through the openstack/cinder interface it was possible to delete another
volume.

The original code made an incorrect assumption on all the possible values returned
from a query to find the target volume. This could lead to deleting a
volume that was not the target of the original delete command from openstack/cinder.

The correction in the module _get_sfvol_by_cinder_vref  validates that the
returned object/volumes-id matchs the requested volume-id with a
comparison of svol['volumeID'] to int(sf_vid)

Closes-Bug: #1782373
Change-Id: I92a8e76c64c4e23dd185875e009132938ace5091
(cherry picked from commit d1b3adfbe471ad99ddf0dd2b483b77435c157aea)
(cherry picked from commit ed2c7b90376fa6f5cd6ef8f46fe9b2d408b0b756)
"}]
commit_message:
SF ensure the correct volume is deleted

When two management systems are available openstack/cinder and
SolidFire-API/GUI  a volume can be deleted though either interface. Thus
if a volume is deleted through the SolidFire-interface and then again
through the openstack/cinder interface it was possible to delete another
volume.

The original code made an incorrect assumption on all the possible values returned
from a query to find the target volume. This could lead to deleting a
volume that was not the target of the original delete command from openstack/cinder.

The correction in the module _get_sfvol_by_cinder_vref  validates that the
returned object/volumes-id matchs the requested volume-id with a
comparison of svol['volumeID'] to int(sf_vid)

Closes-Bug: #1782373
Change-Id: I92a8e76c64c4e23dd185875e009132938ace5091
(cherry picked from commit d1b3adfbe471ad99ddf0dd2b483b77435c157aea)
(cherry picked from commit ed2c7b90376fa6f5cd6ef8f46fe9b2d408b0b756)

commit_message:
add featureset number as a variable

To better identify as we do upstream [1]
what featureset is running have the featureset
configuration files self identify by adding the
featureset variable to the configuration.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/590090/6/playbooks/tripleo-ci/vars/environment_type/ovb.yaml

Change-Id: Iec2673c701c0a12fafdd97c9eba2559d47917b75

commit_message:
fix the container args for fs010

Until podman is default across all fs,
the container args needs to be overridden
in the fs file.

Closes-Bug: #1809280
Change-Id: If061cb533a412439874d7edaf4674101dc804cae

commit_message:
add undercloud_workers, introspect_debug to vexxhost

Two recent settings were added to the env settings
for ovb host clouds.  Undercloud workers is a performance
tweak for the overcloud deployment.
step_introspect_debug enables a tcp dump during
introspection.

Change-Id: I46755d724b9a3fcec7d58c0cfeba986fc20965a4

commit_message:
WIP WES: Add necessary bits for N-1->N standalone upgrade.

This add the standalone upgarde playbook and associated role.  This is
mainly a copy/paste of the standalone deployment, but help
readability and avoid new conditionals.

subject: the virt resize seems to fail when executed by ansible
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6926, 'name': 'Bogdan Dobrelya', 'email': 'bdobreli@redhat.com', 'username': 'bogdando'}, {'_account_id': 8175, 'name': 'Rafael Folco', 'email': 'rfolco@redhat.com', 'username': 'rfolco'}, {'_account_id': 18846, 'name': 'RedHat RDO CI', 'email': 'rdo-ci-admins@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdo-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 9592, 'date': '2018-09-07 21:51:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-09-11 14:23:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 8175, 'date': '2018-09-14 17:54:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

rationale behind running as a 'shell' is to make virt-resize run through a shell with ENV variables available, which does not happen with 'command'. 
LIBGUESTFS_BACKEND=direct virt-resize --expand /dev/sda1 /tmp/reproduce-tmp.EKP46/undercloud.qcow2 /tmp/reproduce-tmp.EKP46/undercloud-resized.qcow2

Without "LIBGUESTFS_BACKEND=direct", virt-resize fails.'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-09-18 11:01:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

This is correct, the shell module works with environment, and the command one does not'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-09-18 11:03:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

so we have more places to fix that. Just grep with environment:'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-09-18 11:21:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

see https://review.openstack.org/#/c/603360'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-09-18 11:25:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

and https://review.openstack.org/#/c/603362/'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-09-26 09:41:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

a false alarm, the environment command works with the command module as my local testing shows. At least for v2.6.3. Let me know if other versions we have in stable branches are affected so we'd still need that change."}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2018-09-26 10:00:41.000000000', 'content': 'Topic set to virt-resize'}, {'account_id': 9592, 'date': '2018-12-31 18:30:14.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
fix nova placement errors for ovb recreate

The nova placement errors were causing the recreate
scripts and tools to fail as well. Making this bug
difficult to test. Update the filter used when
checking for resources for the heat stack.

Related-Bug: #1787910
Change-Id: I607da7c6e0eb2d756da6afb19dbbc6d32a8d94ab

All RDO Third Party CI gates failed, because ansible_pkg_mgr variable is not defined. I don't see it defined either in tripleo-quickstart-extras or tripleo-quickstart .. is that expected? 
I'm asking if it's needed to be fixed (defined) here or in those RDO third party jobs.
However I find it weird, that the change introduces a new variable which doesn't have a default value set."}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-09-27 14:42:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 17:

ansible_pkg_mgr is a fact from ansible, so if ovb is failing for that then that's something else"}, {'account_id': 22873, 'date': '2018-09-27 14:57:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 17:

> ansible_pkg_mgr is a fact from ansible, so if ovb is failing for
 > that then that's something else

Hm, I've noticed, that some of the playbooks turns gather_facts off and it seems to be an issue [1]. Then if I get it right, the variable should be used only in the playbooks, which don't turn gather_facts off.

[1] https://github.com/William-Yeh/ansible-oracle-java/issues/26"}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2018-10-02 08:10:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17:

Martin/Alex, Because this is a fac we cannot set a defalt

commit_message:
Add fedora28 support for quickstart

- libvirt standalone deployment support
- a playbook required for libvrt based standalone deployments

Closes-Bug: #1788270
Depends-On: I245f9341de8f4b9d2ac974d4757e811d17028886
Co-Authored-By: Sorin Sbarnea <ssbarnea@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Alex Schultz <aschultz@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ie302fa7f89a1b6826564f95da88c600d300e39e7
Signed-off-by: Sorin Sbarnea <ssbarnea@redhat.com>

subject: turn off undercloud validations
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 6926, 'name': 'Bogdan Dobrelya', 'email': 'bdobreli@redhat.com', 'username': 'bogdando'}, {'_account_id': 9592, 'name': 'wes hayutin', 'email': 'whayutin@redhat.com', 'username': 'weshayutin'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 28223, 'name': 'Cedric Jeanneret', 'display_name': 'cjeanner (Tengu)', 'email': 'cjeanner@redhat.com', 'username': 'cjeanner'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 9592, 'date': '2018-07-17 15:05:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2018-07-18 06:13:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

I +1 this one, but as a temporary "hack". Ultimate goal would be to get a proper configuration file for the validation, and a way to inject it in the CI for lower specs (as discussed on IRC).

I'm to create a specification for a "validation framework", and this will be taken into account.'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-07-20 09:26:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-07-23 17:49:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

This just installs the validation bits, I didn't think it actually runs the validations"}, {'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2018-07-24 04:34:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Code-Review

> This just installs the validation bits, I didn't think it actually
 > runs the validations

If it set the "enable_validations" in "undercloud.conf", it actually does activate them.

BUT, if I can get I71cf319270bfec50304f24a09da34d0ea8b1ecd8 merged, this change is not necessary anymore.'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-07-24 09:09:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-07-24 09:12:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras/tree/roles/undercloud-deploy/templates/undercloud.conf.j2#n220 does exactly that and sets it ON in undercloud.conf. Not sure why/if that does not really trigger validations, then that is prolly a thing to inspect in tripleoclient logic.'}, {'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2018-07-24 11:05:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

You're 100% right Alex: the "enable_validations" just push an environment file in the deploy command:
https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/master/environments/tripleo-validations.yaml

In the end, that calls a puppet class that just create a validation user + install openstack-tripleo-validations:
https://github.com/openstack/puppet-tripleo/blob/master/manifests/profile/base/validations.pp

This flag doesn't deactivate any preflight validation.

But, as said: if I71cf319270bfec50304f24a09da34d0ea8b1ecd8 goes through, we don't need this change :).'}, {'account_id': 9592, 'date': '2018-12-31 18:03:22.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

out of date'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-17 15:05:54.000000000', 'message': 'turn off undercloud validations

The multinode jobs do not meet validation
critieria. Turn it off in upstream.

Change-Id: I9860e0968a7f463c58c4a6c649ed1af60c29242f
'}]
commit_message:
turn off undercloud validations

The multinode jobs do not meet validation
critieria. Turn it off in upstream.

Change-Id: I9860e0968a7f463c58c4a6c649ed1af60c29242f

commit_message:
ensure rdo/centos has selinux permissive

By default the Centos180x images are selinux enforcing.
Ensure the undercloud on rdo turns selinux to
permissive.

Change-Id: Ib17003f4d32a7760e4c1c04411879d3b41c43037

Hi Mark, this feature adds db backend for storing introspection data, it could be extended by plugins, I'm not sure if this is identical to the "pluggable" you mean.

You can get a whole picture if looking at [1], this patch only contains db support, which is a split from it to reduce patch size.

I'm open to any ideas :)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-19 11:18:24.000000000', 'message': 'Supports database as an introspection data storage

This patch adds db support for the feature described below.

The feature adds the support to store introspection data on ironic-inspector
database. Besides ``none`` and ``swift``, a value of ``database`` is
introduced to ``[processing]store_data``.

Adds a table named ``introspection_data`` to serve as the storage for
introspected data.

When ``[processing]store_data`` is set to ``database``, the introspection
data received during hardware introspection will be save to the database,
introspection data on request will be read from database as well.

Change-Id: I8b29b7b86d90823d29b921ebf64acddbcd2d8d0d
Story: #1726713
Task: #11373
'}, {'created': '2018-08-14 06:52:02.000000000', 'message': 'Multiple backends for introspection data: database

Configurable introspection data storage backend [1] is
proposed to provide flexible extension of introspection
data storage instead of solely Swift storage backend.

This patch adds database support for using ironic-inspector
database as the storage backend.

A table named ``introspection_data`` is created to serve as
the storage for introspected data.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/587698/

Change-Id: I8b29b7b86d90823d29b921ebf64acddbcd2d8d0d

commit_message:
introspection data backend: implements db

Configurable introspection data storage backend [1] is
proposed to provide flexible extension of introspection
data storage instead of the single support of Swift storage
backend.

This patch adds database support for using ironic-inspector
database as the storage backend.

A table named ``introspection_data`` is created to serve as
the storage for introspected data.

[1] http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/ironic-inspector-specs/specs/configurable-introspection-data-backends.html

Change-Id: I8b29b7b86d90823d29b921ebf64acddbcd2d8d0d
Story: 1726713
Task: 11373

[{'created': '2018-03-05 06:26:18.000000000', 'message': 'fs to run tempest w/o skip

Add a featureset to execute full tempest on each
branch in rdo sf 24hour queue to get the latest

to date with the latest results.

'}]
commit_message:
fs to run tempest w/o skip

Add a featureset to execute full tempest on each
branch in rdo sf 24hour queue to get the latest
results w/o a skip to keep the skip file up
to date with the latest results.

Change-Id: Ic03a46bc1481cb80300a48479eb498b4b11575ac

commit_message:
ensure baseos_env config has dns set

when running from libvirt one should use
the dns servers provided by the virthost
for the undercloud.  The overcloud dns
is provided by the undercloud

Change-Id: I9b3d985b6a56f8acffb8c060fb2de69705f0698b

commit_message:
Import utils for parsing docker image

The code was imported from:
https://github.com/hongbin/docker-image-py .
We will leverage this utils to parse and validate the inputed
docker image name.

Change-Id: I37192b661adef16d6bd1a1fdef3f9bd88b0a791c

subject: DNM: Use postgresql for devstack
messages:
[{'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2018-12-28 08:24:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2018-12-31 14:40:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Using postgresql for devstack fails on upgrading the DB. Upgrading the DB version one by one, we don't face this issue. In short, we can avoid it by;

  blazar-db-manage --config-file /etc/blazar/blazar.conf upgrade e66f199a5414
  blazar-db-manage --config-file /etc/blazar/blazar.conf upgrade head"}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2018-12-31 14:40:57.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

It would be nice to have the change described above, but not in this patch.'}]

[{'account_id': 29366, 'date': '2018-10-25 16:30:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-10-25 16:30:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html

'}, {'created': '2018-01-17 03:24:26.000000000', 'message': 'Fix the glance api version warning

policy. Currently, the solution is to set enable_v1_api=False and
enable_v2_api=True in glance-api.conf file. [0]

Change-Id: I412c8507c92a8a9218f02b51ac1ecf33a6feddd5
'}]
commit_message:
Fix the glance api version warning

The Images (Glance) v1 API is deprecated and will be removed on or
after the Pike release, following the standard OpenStack deprecation
policy. Currently, the solution is to set enable_v1_api=False and
enable_v2_api=True in glance-api.conf file. [0]
And when enable_v1_api=False, the enable_v1_registry should be False [1]

[0]: https://github.com/openstack/glance/blob/master/glance/common/config.py#L504
[1]: https://github.com/openstack/glance/blob/master/glance/common/config.py#L482

Change-Id: I412c8507c92a8a9218f02b51ac1ecf33a6feddd5

commit_message:
Avoid namespace isolation on LoadBalancer type svcs

This patch ensures namespace isolation is not applied when svcs
are of LoadBalancer type, regardless of the sg_mode (update or create)

Closes-Bug: 1809649

commit_message:
Support no affinity instance reservation

In the previous patch, `affinity=True` policy is enabled for instance
reservation. This patch enables `affinity=None` policy as the default
affinity policy by changing the query_available_hosts() function to
return a list that allows duplicate hosts and by changing the DB
schema to allow null affinity value.

The release note is coming in a follow up patch.

Change-Id: I615dc02c1e42267945996b20ea52cfa7f48f35f1
Blueprint: no-affinity-instance-reservation

commit_message:
Temporarily disable dynamic_routing and bgpvpn from scenario004

Upstream dynamic_routing project has switched to os-ken. To implement
this change we are disabling exercising dr adn bgpvpn which requires it
to fix packaging, get new package promoted and then fix puppet-neutron
to use the right bgp_speaker_driver.

Change-Id: Ia9f2c4a9bca926a9c7a61fd49ca1005708478e25

commit_message:
Normalise in-repo GPG key implementation

To ensure that we have a consistent implementation
between the galera_client and galera_server roles,
we change the galera_server role to match galera_client
as was done in I520ccbadf3320b0d07fc83e3dbec9ea2bd16ec83

This updates it to a mechanism which will be easier to
maintain.

Change-Id: I7ac1a5e3a05aa3d0b4fae86c4a325ef147a9a528
(cherry picked from commit c2b73bff5229257ab5b976f503b9ef21531600f7)

[{'created': '2018-12-18 16:53:05.000000000', 'message': 'Switch to cirros 0.4.0

This supports ext4 partitions with metadata_csum(as created
by ubuntu bionic by default).

Also Using it with the e1000 virt driver cirros sees the nics.

This allows us to remove 2 of the special cases we had inserted
when the CI jobs were switched to bionic.

Change-Id: I68165110dd57ed314cbc29430f84ff5092065d38
Story: #2004604
Task: #28570
Task: #28499
'}]
commit_message:
Switch to cirros 0.4.0

This supports ext4 partitions with metadata_csum(as created
by ubuntu bionic by default).

Also Using it with the e1000 virt driver cirros sees the nics.

This allows us to remove 2 of the special cases we had inserted
when the CI jobs were switched to bionic.

Change-Id: I68165110dd57ed314cbc29430f84ff5092065d38
Story: #2004604
Task: #28570
Task: #28499

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-22 23:18:23.000000000', 'message': 'Use mtu of Tenant network to control neutron global_physnet_mtu

Change: I11e38f82eb9040f77412fe8ad200fcc48031e2f8 introduced mtu
property for composable networks. This change set the MTU of the
Tenant network as the global_physnet_mtu for neutron, unless the
NeutronGlobalPhysnetMtu is overridden. The default MTU used if
no MTU is defined for the Tenant network is 1500. (The same
default was previously used for the NeutronGlobalPhysnetMtu
parameter.)

Change-Id: I5e60d52ad571e1cdb3b82cd1d9947e33fa682bf8

commit_message:
Use mtu of Tenant network to control neutron global_physnet_mtu

Change: I11e38f82eb9040f77412fe8ad200fcc48031e2f8 introduced mtu
property for composable networks. This change set the MTU of the
Tenant network as the global_physnet_mtu for neutron, unless the
NeutronGlobalPhysnetMtu is overridden. The default MTU used if
no MTU is defined for the Tenant network is 1500. (The same
default was previously used for the NeutronGlobalPhysnetMtu
parameter.)

Change-Id: I5e60d52ad571e1cdb3b82cd1d9947e33fa682bf8

Replace Ocata jobs with Rocky

Ocata is in extended maintanance mode, while Rocky needs testing.

commit_message:
Ensure ssh client is available for rsync

This is in a seperate package on ubuntu/centos systems and bundled
in openssh on suse. The ssh client was missing on centos so this
patch ensures it is always present for all distributions.

Change-Id: I4885f88938bd49ae81ce8f0a85fde46ddbe311a4

cool patch. I wonder if this is a good opportunity to tie overcloud neutron configuration to the overcloud network configuration. e.g. having NeutronGlobalPhysnetMtu apply to the tenant network - or come up with a different var that sets both? In any case, it would probably be better as a follow up patch. Thoughts?'}, {'account_id': 21909, 'date': '2018-09-24 16:09:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 21909, 'date': '2018-09-24 16:09:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-09-25 05:32:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11:

> cool patch. I wonder if this is a good opportunity to tie overcloud
 > neutron configuration to the overcloud network configuration. e.g.
 > having NeutronGlobalPhysnetMtu apply to the tenant network - or
 > come up with a different var that sets both? In any case, it would
 > probably be better as a follow up patch. Thoughts?

This is a good suggestion. It would be trivial to follow up with a patch that set NeutronGlobalPhysnetMtu to the MTU set for the Tenant network in network_data.yaml by adding the parameter to network-environment.yaml.

We may want to add support for 'ml2.physical_network_mtus' as well? That would allow us to have different MTU for Tenant and External networks. But I'm not sure how that option apply in the OVN world.


https://docs.openstack.org/neutron/pike/configuration/ml2-conf.html#ml2.physical_network_mtus"}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-10-21 19:25:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Patch Set 11 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-10-22 23:18:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13: Patch Set 12 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-10-23 07:40:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 14: Patch Set 13 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-11-06 07:30:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15: Patch Set 14 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 6681, 'date': '2018-11-06 18:45:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15: Code-Review-1

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-04 13:08:03.000000000', 'message': "Add MTU to neutron networks and nic-config templates

Neutron has support[1] to set the guaranteed MTU for
networks and network segments so that this is exposed
to plug-ins. In interest of supporting the use of
plug-ins to configure network devices in the future
this change adds MTU property on neutron networks.

The new (optional) property 'mtu' in the network
defenitions in 'network_data.yaml' is used to control
the MTU settings. By default the mtu is '1500'.

We already configure the MTU on the ctlplane neutron
networks, this adds the MTU to composable networks.

Also update the nic-config sample templates to include
mtu settings. A heat value resource is added to
nic-config templates to get the required minimum MTU
value for bridges, bonds and member interfaces to
ensure the MTU is large enough to allow the largest
configured MTU to traverse the path.

Closes-Bug: #1790537
Change-Id: I11e38f82eb9040f77412fe8ad200fcc48031e2f8
"}, {'created': '2018-09-04 17:14:25.000000000', 'message': "Add MTU to neutron networks and nic-config templates

commit_message:
Add MTU to neutron networks and nic-config templates

Neutron has support[1] to set the guaranteed MTU for
networks and network segments so that this is exposed
to plug-ins. In interest of supporting the use of
plug-ins to configure network devices in the future
this change adds MTU property on neutron networks.

The new (optional) property 'mtu' in the network
defenitions in 'network_data.yaml' is used to control
the MTU settings. By default the mtu is '1500'.

We already configure the MTU on the ctlplane neutron
networks, this adds the MTU to composable networks.

Also update the nic-config sample templates to include
mtu settings. A heat value resource is added to
nic-config templates to get the required minimum
viable MTU value for bridges, bonds and member
interfaces to ensure the MTU is large enough to allow
the largest configured MTU to traverse the path.

Closes-Bug: #1790537
Change-Id: I11e38f82eb9040f77412fe8ad200fcc48031e2f8

giving the user the ability to customize links as they need.

commit_message:
Move link options to a link file

The link options being set within the network files, which functional,
does not expose all of the link capabilities we have within a specific
link file. This change implements link files per network interface
giving the user the ability to customize links as they need.

Change-Id: Ie999c541a6a566141e81c6d9f95b8a30bbbefa8c
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Replace Chinese punctuation with English punctuation

Curly quotes(Chinese punctuation) usually input from Chinese input
method. When read from english context, it makes some confusion.

Change-Id: I5fbd000bbc3f8584ef937dbe9cc6daa7e94fe568
Closes-Bug: #1792131
(cherry picked from commit 7d9e2ed01913d38676a822331f08dcd724223932)

commit_message:
Replace Chinese punctuation with English punctuation

Curly quotes(Chinese punctuation) usually input from Chinese input
method. When read from english context, it makes some confusion.

Change-Id: Ibddb45adf164c47ed848a3aab5f2ae40d4021eac
Closes-Bug: #1792131
(cherry picked from commit d285fe6602fe6b43e1dd939e96fb5677aa2ce88c)

commit_message:
Enhance Vitrage resource APIs

Add a new API for retrieving the number of resources,
 similar to 'vitrage alarm count'.
The API includes filter and group-by options.
Add filter option to 'vitrage resource list'

Story: 2004669
Task: 28650
Task: 28656

Change-Id: I3b9f2be581dcbd4a539b8040a387512b55597953

commit_message:
Write libvirt logs to host

This modifies the libvirt chart to write logs directly to the
host by default. This also modifies the fluentbit and fluentd
charts to capture libvirt logs from the host and index them into
Elasticsearch

Change-Id: I0bbc49d2c0d4cf4895f797e48f309f308ffd021f

subject: Use openstackdocstheme
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-27 18:22:53.000000000', 'message': 'Use openstackdocstheme

Use openstackdocstheme for consistency with all specs displayed on
specs.openstack.org.

This includes updating requirements to current versions, updating specs
building to not publish dirtrees and tread warnings as errors, update
index page, and update settings for the theme.

Change-Id: I905f404361a98d9af1a4ba5c52b8e04acda1688e
'}]
commit_message:
Use openstackdocstheme

Use openstackdocstheme for consistency with all specs displayed on
specs.openstack.org.

This includes updating requirements to current versions, updating specs
building to not publish dirtrees and tread warnings as errors, update
index page, and update settings for the theme.

Change-Id: I905f404361a98d9af1a4ba5c52b8e04acda1688e

commit_message:
flatten snmp service configuration

This change combines the previous puppet and docker files into a single
file that performs the docker service installation and configuration.

Depends-On: https://review.rdoproject.org/r/#/c/16994/
Change-Id: I35616168df73d8ae7790816b88d06d5bff9c151a
Related-Blueprint: services-yaml-flattening

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-15 12:50:30.000000000', 'message': "Add retry install packages linter

We often fail because of network issues in the gate (and possibly
users who are deploying might run into the same).  We should make it
a priority to always retry when possible.

This patch adds retries to the linter so that we are always retrying
to install packages and block if we're not doing that.

Change-Id: I7741d1b12415889b9604d17e225d241a5b7e339a
"}, {'created': '2018-06-15 13:08:59.000000000', 'message': "Add retry install packages linter

commit_message:
Add retry install packages linter

We often fail because of network issues in the gate (and possibly
users who are deploying might run into the same).  We should make it
a priority to always retry when possible.

This patch adds retries to the linter so that we are always retrying
to install packages and block if we're not doing that.

Change-Id: I7741d1b12415889b9604d17e225d241a5b7e339a

commit_message:
k8s: drop use of master_index

We no longer need to use master_index because we actually just
run the SoftwareDeployment on the first server of the cluster,
which is controlled by Heat.

Change-Id: I762498707d606c6edbdeaa98ce52763837008d00

commit_message:
nova_compute fails to start in tls-everywhere configuration

With tls-everywhere enabled connecting to keystone endpoint fails
to retrieve the URL for the placement endpoint as the certificate
can not be verified. While verification is disabled to check the
placement endpoint later, it is not to communicate with keystone.
This disables certificate verification for communication with
keystone.

Related-Bug: 1784155

Change-Id: I317dd62f3a555f375d540a63c21a6fb38d37ca96
(cherry picked from commit a99820a80cd99690c096553dcdc5e7f7472c02f1)
(cherry picked from commit 14af0677c87a64dd7ad96fad41d74da1db3d8e07)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-06 15:12:59.000000000', 'message': "Change step to start nova placement and make compute wait for it

There is a deployment race where nova-placement fails to start if
the nova api db migration have not finished before starting it.
We start nova placement early to make sure it is up before the
nova-compute services get started. Since in HA scenario there is
no sync in between the nodes on the current worked deployment step
we might have the situation that the placement service gets started
on C1/2 when the nova api db sync is not yet finished on C0.

We have two possibilities:
1) start placement later and verify that nova-computes recover correct
2) verify that db migration on nova_api db finished before start nova-
placement on the controllers

2) which was addressed via https://review.openstack.org/610966 showed
problems:
a) the docker/podman container failed to start with some file not found
error, therefore this was reverted in https://review.openstack.org/619607

b) when the scrip were running on different controllers at the same
time, the way how nova's db_version() is implemented has issues, which
is being worked on in https://review.openstack.org/619622

This patch addresses 1) and moves placement service start to step_4
and adds an additional task on the computes to wait until the placement
service is up.

Closes-Bug: #1784155

Change-Id: Ifb5ffc4b25f5ca266560bc0ac96c73071ebd1c9f
(cherry picked from commit cc61ff93ec41e149caba31cc21524f37def4d07e)
(cherry picked from commit 3363bcbf8d7a4c16ec673361adf82c76213e1cbd)
"}, {'created': '2018-12-07 08:44:56.000000000', 'message': "Change step to start nova placement and make compute wait for it

There is a deployment race where nova-placement fails to start if
the nova api db migration have not finished before starting it.
We start nova placement early to make sure it is up before the
nova-compute services get started. Since in HA scenario there is
no sync in between the nodes on the current worked deployment step
we might have the situation that the placement service gets started
on C1/2 when the nova api db sync is not yet finished on C0.

We have two possibilities:
1) start placement later and verify that nova-computes recover correct
2) verify that db migration on nova_api db finished before start nova-
placement on the controllers

2) which was addressed via https://review.openstack.org/610966 showed
problems:
a) the docker/podman container failed to start with some file not found
error, therefore this was reverted in https://review.openstack.org/619607

b) when the scrip were running on different controllers at the same
time, the way how nova's db_version() is implemented has issues, which
is being worked on in https://review.openstack.org/619622

This patch addresses 1) and moves placement service start to step_4
and adds an additional task on the computes to wait until the placement
service is up.

Closes-Bug: #1784155

Change-Id: Ifb5ffc4b25f5ca266560bc0ac96c73071ebd1c9f
(cherry picked from commit cc61ff93ec41e149caba31cc21524f37def4d07e)
(cherry picked from commit 3363bcbf8d7a4c16ec673361adf82c76213e1cbd)

commit_message:
Change step to start nova placement and make compute wait for it

There is a deployment race where nova-placement fails to start if
the nova api db migration have not finished before starting it.
We start nova placement early to make sure it is up before the
nova-compute services get started. Since in HA scenario there is
no sync in between the nodes on the current worked deployment step
we might have the situation that the placement service gets started
on C1/2 when the nova api db sync is not yet finished on C0.

We have two possibilities:
1) start placement later and verify that nova-computes recover correct
2) verify that db migration on nova_api db finished before start nova-
placement on the controllers

2) which was addressed via https://review.openstack.org/610966 showed
problems:
a) the docker/podman container failed to start with some file not found
error, therefore this was reverted in https://review.openstack.org/619607

b) when the scrip were running on different controllers at the same
time, the way how nova's db_version() is implemented has issues, which
is being worked on in https://review.openstack.org/619622

This patch addresses 1) and moves placement service start to step_4
and adds an additional task on the computes to wait until the placement
service is up.

Closes-Bug: #1784155

Change-Id: Ifb5ffc4b25f5ca266560bc0ac96c73071ebd1c9f
(cherry picked from commit cc61ff93ec41e149caba31cc21524f37def4d07e)
(cherry picked from commit 3363bcbf8d7a4c16ec673361adf82c76213e1cbd)

subject: Update kolla_config to deal with keystone fernet key rotation
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages: [{'account_id': 9098, 'date': '2018-12-21 22:25:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9098, 'date': '2018-12-21 22:26:48.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from fernet_key_rotation-queens to fernet_key_rotation'}, {'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2018-12-22 03:50:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-12-29 20:20:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-21 22:25:54.000000000', 'message': 'Update kolla_config to deal with keystone fernet key rotation

The kolla config for the keystone container currently copies over
all of the config area using "merge".  This makes sense for most of
keystone's config, but it causes a problem with the fernet keys
used for creating tokens that are stored in the config area.

Good security practices recommend keys be rotated, and keystone
and tripleo both offer the ability for an operator to trigger key
rotation.  The rotation policy limits the number of previous keys
that are retained, which is 5 by default in a tripleo deployment.
The rotation all occurs on the undercloud, and the new set of keys
is provided to the keystone container via the bind mount used for
our kolla config source.  Due to the use of "merge", old fernet
keys that have been deleted on the undercloud due to the rotation
policy will persist for the keystone container since "merge" skips
deletion of files.

This patch adds a second source for keystone's kolla_config, which
is used specifically for the fernet keys.  The fernet key source
has "merge" set to false, and is restricted to the fernet-keys
subdirectory.  This will ensure that any keys that are no longer
present in the kolla config provided by the undercloud are also not
present in the keystone container.

Change-Id: I83d1bfaba321d2fbd5cad1b8fb9478f788f5e238
(cherry picked from commit 5bff1c5fc9a7dd5cdf9c1027e7c0648f3a6fc5b3)
'}]
commit_message:
Update kolla_config to deal with keystone fernet key rotation

The kolla config for the keystone container currently copies over
all of the config area using "merge".  This makes sense for most of
keystone's config, but it causes a problem with the fernet keys
used for creating tokens that are stored in the config area.

Good security practices recommend keys be rotated, and keystone
and tripleo both offer the ability for an operator to trigger key
rotation.  The rotation policy limits the number of previous keys
that are retained, which is 5 by default in a tripleo deployment.
The rotation all occurs on the undercloud, and the new set of keys
is provided to the keystone container via the bind mount used for
our kolla config source.  Due to the use of "merge", old fernet
keys that have been deleted on the undercloud due to the rotation
policy will persist for the keystone container since "merge" skips
deletion of files.

This patch adds a second source for keystone's kolla_config, which
is used specifically for the fernet keys.  The fernet key source
has "merge" set to false, and is restricted to the fernet-keys
subdirectory.  This will ensure that any keys that are no longer
present in the kolla config provided by the undercloud are also not
present in the keystone container.

Change-Id: I83d1bfaba321d2fbd5cad1b8fb9478f788f5e238
(cherry picked from commit 5bff1c5fc9a7dd5cdf9c1027e7c0648f3a6fc5b3)

commit_message:
Update kolla_config to deal with keystone fernet key rotation

The kolla config for the keystone container currently copies over
all of the config area using "merge".  This makes sense for most of
keystone's config, but it causes a problem with the fernet keys
used for creating tokens that are stored in the config area.

Good security practices recommend keys be rotated, and keystone
and tripleo both offer the ability for an operator to trigger key
rotation.  The rotation policy limits the number of previous keys
that are retained, which is 5 by default in a tripleo deployment.
The rotation all occurs on the undercloud, and the new set of keys
is provided to the keystone container via the bind mount used for
our kolla config source.  Due to the use of "merge", old fernet
keys that have been deleted on the undercloud due to the rotation
policy will persist for the keystone container since "merge" skips
deletion of files.

This patch adds a second source for keystone's kolla_config, which
is used specifically for the fernet keys.  The fernet key source
has "merge" set to false, and is restricted to the fernet-keys
subdirectory.  This will ensure that any keys that are no longer
present in the kolla config provided by the undercloud are also not
present in the keystone container.

Change-Id: I83d1bfaba321d2fbd5cad1b8fb9478f788f5e238
(cherry picked from commit 5bff1c5fc9a7dd5cdf9c1027e7c0648f3a6fc5b3)

* Because yum-config-manager doesn't have a dry-run

commit_message:
Make galera_client role idempotent

* Because yum-config-manager doesn't have a dry-run
  option or doesn't show a change status, we need
  to rely on something else. The yum_repository
  ansible module can bring the idempotency but
  needs the priorities plugins to be enabled, which
  is what we do here.

* The tox.ini is now switched to test idempotency

* The test playbook is adapted for idempotency

Change-Id: I9a1c30b47caf98f6325706fbb1af6fa38a28d4c7
Co-Authored-By: Jean-Philippe Evrard <jean-philippe@evrard.me>

commit_message:
Update provider networks plugin to support multiple network mappings

This patch updates the provider networks plugin by adding support
for network interface to bridge mappings. For each flat/vlan provider
network, a network_interface can be defined that will be added to an OVS
provider bridge automatically. This supercedes the network_interface override
for OVS-based deployments, including OVS, OVS w/ DVR, and OVN, that was
only available outside of the plugin.

Change-Id: I99d95ab103f9d64726a809eb81db69e0b2b18ffb

commit_message:
Fix ServiceNetMap THT file reference

The document shows the ServiceNetMap defaults as being in the
``overcloud.yaml`` file, however, the defaults are actually in
``network/service_net_map.j2.yaml`` file.

Change-Id: I2e57de3cb42a97cb2de1627920572a2ddd4766ed
Closes-Bug: #1708663

messages:
[{'account_id': 29465, 'date': '2018-12-26 04:13:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-12-26 04:13:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 24209, 'date': '2018-12-26 05:05:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 29222, 'date': '2018-12-26 15:20:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 13039, 'date': '2018-12-27 21:19:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-12-29 17:39:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

Depends-On: Ied543e70491ff85d6fab4371812bca802c6b1032
Depends-On: If1cef78c55041b476103bc028591b72c85cddb6d
Change-Id: I6f669b8588fe14db9166694349e5523a443d70cd
'}]
commit_message:
Add feature set to test public bond network isolation

Overcloud deployments using public bond network
isolation have been tested downstream previously.
As part of the effort to consolidate upstream and
downstream test settings, this review adds a feature
set for public bond network isolation that should
be able to be used with OVB in both test environments.

Depends-On: Ied543e70491ff85d6fab4371812bca802c6b1032
Depends-On: If1cef78c55041b476103bc028591b72c85cddb6d
Change-Id: I6f669b8588fe14db9166694349e5523a443d70cd

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 8367, 'date': '2018-03-14 08:40:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

The dynamic set is only executed when tempest_workers is not defined, plus, it checks the number of cpus from the undercloud, not overcloud, In the beginning, when we started to run tempest (before containers) that was a good idea, and earlier configs set the undercloud to have 6 vcpus and 2 vcpus to controller, but today with containers, i don't know if that's still valid. 2 vcpus by default is good, for some jobs we can set as 1 vcpu (the job that runs ceilometer for example is 1 vcpu)"}, {'account_id': 12393, 'date': '2018-03-14 09:00:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
update tempest defaults, move workers to tempest role

tempest_workers should be in the validate_tempest role now
test_tempest is not used
tempest_regex -> test_regex

Change-Id: Ic54db3ac6ea795e91b0a9e930ba3d62ad4ea26d9

commit_message:
[DNM]: Apply workaround for P->Q upgrades.

There are two issues at the time of upgrading
from Pike to Queens: one related to the service
name change from one release to another and other
with python-keystoneauth1 that needs to be
updated [0].

Appending this env file and removing keystoneauh1
workarounds it until both issues will get solved.

[0] - https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1533432

Change-Id: Iec3621ad4235e28ffd09f879b1a51db237817dd6

commit_message:
Add CorosyncUpgradeAuthkeySecret for the corosync encryption

This is a shared key that will be used only on upgrades from (O->P) in
order to create /etc/corosync/authkey on all nodes. It is not needed
except on upgrades because pcs with the appropriate encryption flag
takes care of that automagically.

Change-Id: Id066f644e08ac9860c38c22607c55e6da60a1675
